characters: ON THE TRAIL OF THE MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor HARI SELDON stands on a rotating platform suspende the center of a spherical metal chamber. He is old and frail, but his eyes are bright. As the platform spins Seldon is displayed for one and the another and another of the JUDGES seated along the perime The Judges are moving their lips, speaking rapidly into w ornamental headsets, in never-ending consultation with ea other. All we hear is a single unsettling androgynous voi

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Doctor Hari Seldon, you stand before this court as an enemy of the people. State for the record your opinions concerning the future of this planet.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I have said, and say again, that Trantor will lie in ruins within three centuries.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: You do not consider this statement a disloyal one?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Scientific truth is beyond loyalty and disloyalty.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: You say your statement represents scientific truth.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: On what basis?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: On the basis of the mathematics of psycho-history.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: A new field of study you claim can accurately predict events hundreds of years in the future. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Hundreds of years. Thousands. Even tens of thousands.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Can you prove that this mathematics is sound?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I can. To another psycho-historian.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Of which you are the only one.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: How convenient.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Seeing that I am currently on trial for my life, I would say that it is decidedly inconvenient. Seldon smiles a little. The emotionless faces of the Judg watch him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: The court suggests your predictions of disaster are intended to destroy public confidence in the government.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: That is not so.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Then what is the purpose of your work?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I believe our future can be changed.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Easily?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: No. With great difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Let us pretend we do not question the validity of your theories. How do we save Trantor? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: We donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Now you are contradicting yourself, Doctor. Can we or can we not save this planet from destruction?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: The fate of this planet is of no consequence. For the first time even these Judges are rendered speechl They stop talking into their headsets. Listen. HARI SELDON (CONTвЂ™D) The coming destruction of Trantor is not an event in itself, isolated in the scheme of human development. It is the climax to a drama which began centuries ago and is accelerating in pace continuously. (short pause) I refer to the decline and fall of the Galactic Empire. The Judges all begin to protest at the same time. The sou system fights to organize fragments.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Treason-- Openly declare-- You go too far, sir-- Outrageous-- You-- (settling on one) You are talking about an empire that has stood for 12,000 years and holds a quadrillion human beings!

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I never said I was glad the empire would fall. Only that it will. The platform slowly rotates. Seldon counters their hostil with his usual scientific detachment: HARI SELDON (CONTвЂ™D) The end is dictated by a rising bureaucracy, a receding initiative, a stagnation of commerce, an increase in political insurgency-- and a hundred other minor factors.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: And when the empire is gone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: The accumulated knowledge of the human race will be lost forever. Interstellar wars will wage. Galactic trade decay. Populations decline. Worlds will lose touch with one another, and so matters will remain.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Forever?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: A second empire will rise, but not for 30,000 years. Between it and our civilization lies twelve hundred generations of suffering humanity. Between SeldonвЂ™s responses, the Judges consult furiousl one another, then comes the question:

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Can we save the future?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: A galaxy full of people contains an enormous inertia. The fall of the empire is far too massive a thing to stop. But if the onrushing events can be deflected, just a little, I believe we can rebuild civilization in a single millenniun.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I have begun my final and greatest psycho-historical calculation. The resulting equation will safely guide us through the events of the next one thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s be very clear, Doctor. You want the human race to entrust its future to a mathematical equation no one understands but you?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Elaborate please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: My testimony here today is already damning enough for the court to find me guilty of numerous transgressions. The tale of my trial and execution will spread throughout the galaxy and an increasingly desperate humanity will gravitate toward my teachings--

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Stop right there.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: --studying the equation in a futile attempt to stop the fall I predicted centuries earlier. As our current age of science reverts back to one of mysticism, the inhabitants of our dwindling future will view me as a prophet and messiah--

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) That is quite enough.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: --sent to deliver them into the new kingdom that lies at the end of the darkness. Society will, of course, reorganize around this new religion. Finally socioeconomic forces will secularize the equation until it is the foundation of civil government--

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Doctor, we will have order!

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: --concluding my thousand year plan. The Judges exchange shocked looks. Finally, that voice sa

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: This court is stunned and outraged by the scope and magnitude of your arrogant presumptions.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Yes. I thought you might be. The Judges have had enough. They place their palms down o the control pads abruptly deciding his fate. ItвЂ™s unani (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARTIFICIAL VOICE
dialogues.text: Hari Seldon, you are found guilty of treason and sentenced to death. The platform stops rotating and Seldon is suddenly encase a COLUMN OF ENERGY. His calm exterior gives way, just a b enough to confirm that he fears death like the rest of us ARTIFICIAL VOICE (CONTвЂ™D) Do you have any last words?

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Not at the moment. Suddenly one of the Judges tears off his headset. He may the eldest. He looks across at Seldon, with great intensi

dialogues.speaker: ELDEST JUDGE
dialogues.text: You are either the most brilliant man whoвЂ™s ever lived, sir, or the most dangerously insane! Seldon looks almost intrigued. As if wondering that himse

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™1l find out in a thousand years. ...and he is DISINTEGRATED before our eyes. The column of energy disappears and now there is only an empty platform small automatic arm neatly sweeps his ASHES into a tiny h cur TO: THE SELDON EQUATION floats in some endless white nothingn The mathematical string is solving itself, growing larger larger, the strange symbols appearing at an astonishing r TITLE AND CREDITS begin as we race down the length of the expanding equation, faster and faster, as if hurling into future. We pass through numbers and symbols at random and see images from the next one thousand years of human hist --STARSHIPS are torn and twisted at the site of a great battle. Petrified CORPSES tumble endlessly through the vo We speed down the equation and: --Tattered SURVIVORS make their way down a BOMBED STREET searching the ruins for food. They eat like starved anima We speed down the equation and: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --The surface of a PLANET GOES DARK as the last of its po reserve fails. One of the inhabitants lifts a BURNING TOR We speed down the equation and: --People die in agony from some PLAGUE, open sores on the skin, diseased corpses piled high. We speed down the equation and: --A group of tired SEARCHERS force open an old vault and into a blinding white space. See the EQUATION. It has gro huge, rising high above them, like a mathematical monolit They fall onto their knees in awe. We speed down the equation and: --A HOODED PRIEST leads a ragged CONGREGATION in prayer. moment later we see they are worshipping the Seldon equat We speed down the equation and: --A town MARKETPLACE grows crowded and wild as trade retu We speed down the equation and: --RESEARCHERS walk along a rickety SCAFFOLDING being buil around the equation. They study the strange mathematics a copy the symbols into large books. We speed down the equation and: --A small hill is covered with the slain bodies of a SAVA HORDE. Civilized SOLDIERS wearing uniforms raise their FL On it is a symbol of the equation. We speed down the equation and: --The images rush toward us, faster now, CITIES RISING as industry grows, the POPULATION sky-rocketing, advanced mo of TRANSPORTATION appearing, ROCKETS racing toward the st The credits END and we slow down, completing our trip thr time. We pull back. See TECHNICIANS inside of the equatio The men and women wear high-tech bodysuits as they make t way down bizarre corridors formed by the mathematics. The speak into microphones recording any changes in the equat We pull back further and realize the extent of this facil THE EQUATION HAS GROWN IMPOSSIBLY LARGE, stretching endle above and below. We hear the VOICES OF A HUNDRED TECHNICI in a cacophony of ominous unknowable jargon. And we confi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: вЂњ1,000 YEARS LATERвЂќ cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet Haven is an idyllic fusion of advanced technol and natural beauty. In the capital city is a gorgeous squ FILLED WITH PEOPLE enjoying a perfect day on a perfect wo Somewhere among them is BAYTA and TORAN. They seem like a other happy couple. Bayta stares up at the sky, and sudde a playful look comes over her:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Do you think itвЂ™s going to rain?

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I mean rain. Do you think itвЂ™s going to descend. From the sky.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be ridiculous. She looks disappointed in him.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This planet is climate controlled--

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (irritated) I know, IвЂ™m trying to fantasize.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: About atmospheric precipitation? Bayta steps in front of Toran and brings him to a halt. S moves close, and quietly asks:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: WouldnвЂ™t it be fun to get caught in the rain?

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m afraid IвЂ™m not following you. Bayta looks frustrated. Takes his hand, and pulls him alo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I know this will come as a shock, but there was a time when people were commonly rained upon.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Is this going to be another one of your history lessons?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) What will the weather be today... too hot? Too cold? No one knew.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Sounds horrific.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I want you to pretend itвЂ™s starting to rain.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: But--

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I felt a drop. Did you? ThereвЂ™s another. And another!

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Bayta, please--

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a downpour, weвЂ™re soaked to the skin. What do we do, Toran?

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: (guessing) Run for shelter?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: No, you idiot. You kiss the girl.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Inside of the rainfall?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Because itвЂ™s romantic.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s romantic to expose yourself and your partner to inclement weather? Suddenly Toran stops, realizing.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I know you. What is this conversation really about? Bayta looks pleased with herself, like she trapped him ag

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: The Seldon Plan.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. They wind their way through the square. Toran doesnвЂ™t w to have this conversation. But he knows there is no way o

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: The equation tells us the future.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Yes. And without it, Foundation never would have rebuilt civilization in a thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: You do? Bayta gestures at the impressive city square all around t

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: We made it through the dark ages. ThereвЂ™s been no war in a hundred years. Peace and prosperity has spread across the known universe. The more positive she sounds, the more worried Toran beco (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Political, social, and economic conflicts are identified and resolved before they even begin. Toran waits for the axe to fall.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Psycho-history has enabled us to optimize our future, ushering in an age of unparalleled progress! Bayta turns to him. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the human race will never again be caught in the rain. (short pause) CanвЂ™t you see why thatвЂ™s wrong? He thinks about it for a moment. Nods his head a little a

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: No. Bayta gives up. Starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have the same quibbles with the current Foundation administration as you. But without the equation, the future would be nothing more than an endless series of unknown terrors. As a historian you know--

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I know there was a time when men and women faced tomorrow bravely.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: And now, we've replaced вЂњbraveryвЂќ with advanced mathematics. A more than fair exchange if you ask me. Bayta sees something and reacts.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I think weвЂ™re being watched. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BUSINESSMAN sits at a table on the edge of the square. least thatвЂ™s what he looks like, in his conservative su with that BRIEFCASE on the ground next to his feet. PRITC lifts a CUP to his lips. He does appear to be watching th

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Hm. What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Well weвЂ™re supposed to be on our honeymoon, arenвЂ™t we?

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: So, itвЂ™s that kissing business again, is it?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m afraid so, darling. Bayta and Toran kiss. They look like a nice couple, deepl in love, sharing a kiss in the middle of this bustling cr They pull apart. Just a bit. Bayta peeks over his shoulde At the edge of the square, that businessman returns his c to the table. Reads his PAPER. Pays them no more attentio

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: Was he suitably impressed?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so.

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: But that was a pretty good kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: It was. Toran looks up in the air, with:

dialogues.speaker: TORAN
dialogues.text: And not a cloud in the-- SOMETHING FALLS from the sky. Too fast to see. It hits th ground with a DEAFENING EXPLOSION. The world TILTS, crazi And everything goes pitch BLACK. Now we see the square in ruins. THICK SMOKE hangs in the obscuring the RUBBLE AND BODIES. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is no sound but a RINGING. It is the ringing in BaytaвЂ™s ears as she struggles to h feet. She stumbles forward and Bayta stares at the PEOPLE COVERED IN DIRT AND BLOOD, mou open in silent haunting screams. She looks around, suddenly, wildly, searching for Toran. is not here, and Bayta stumbles. She stares at a HUMAN ARM reaching out from under the rub Suddenly Pritcher is beside her: He is saying something, yelling, we donвЂ™t know what, al can hear is that damned RINGING. Pritcher helps her and they run. Up and down the street we see glimpses of a city being to asunder. BUILDINGS ARE FALLING. They race through the smoke and Slowly the sound begins to return. Anguished CRIES now we wish we couldnвЂ™t hear. SCREAMS. MORE SCARED PEOPLE struggle to get out of the square. Bay sees them. She reaches out and They are encased in an odd GLOW. Suddenly the people are REDUCED TO SKELETONS in front of Bayta watches as the bones fall. She canвЂ™t move. Just stares in horror. Pritcher grabs h and pulls her down out of sight. A LINE OF SOLDIERS emerges from the smoke, their faces hi under helmets. They are FIRING. Pritcher forces Bayta into the twisted WRECKAGE of a vehi Through broken glass they watch: The soldiers disappear back into the smoke. Now a SHIP FL OVERHEAD too fast to see. An EXPLOSION across the street The distant SCREAMS continue....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel has suffered obvious structural damage. SURVIVO gather in the lobby watching static on the cracked TV scr BAYTA looks battered and bloodied. Her tears dried up. Sh waits with the rest as a desk CLERK tries to fix the pict An ELDERLY COUPLE holds onto one another. A MAN sits at t bar burying himself in DRINK. A WOMAN walks the lobby lik zombie. An EDUCATED MAN fights to keep his BROKEN GLASSES his face, as if to retain some small dignity. Men and wom alike are quietly WEEPING. A PRIEST moves among the WOUND PRITCHER stands apart from the others. Just watches. Wait A harsh WHINE comes over the speakers, and everyone looks The television suddenly clears to reveal the PRESIDENT OF PLANET seated at his desk. He looks composed, but strange so, and smiles for the cameras:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Good evening, this is the President. Less than one hour ago, I surrendered the planet to the hostile forces of an aggressor identified as вЂњThe Mule.вЂќ Some people hold each other tighter. Others donвЂ™t dare On screen the President smiles:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is an unconditional surrender. But I say to you now that our world has not been imprisoned, but freed. Soon the entire galaxy will join us in this liberation-- Someone hands the President something. We donвЂ™t see wha is. But the President seems absolutely delighted. He look down at his hands, then off screen, at somebody we canвЂ™

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. Thanks so much. And now he turns back to the cameras, still smiling happi and RAISES A GUN to his temple:

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good people of Haven, itвЂ™s time for me to go now. I leave this office with high hopes...and confidence in the future. Farewell-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone in the lobby watches in horror. Their bodies jer at the SOUND OF THE SHOT. Some turn away and others CRY O The picture goes crazy again. A YOUNG WOMAN gets hysteric

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: I want to go home. I donвЂ™t want to stay here. I want to go home--

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: No oneвЂ™s going anywhere. DonвЂ™t you get it?!

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Stop yelling at her.

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED MAN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand. What happened to the planetary defenses? How could this вЂњMuleвЂќ just march in and take over the whole world?

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MAN
dialogues.text: Maybe heвЂ™s not human. Everybody turns toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?!

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MAN
dialogues.text: It means we donвЂ™t know what he is .-..or what he isnвЂ™t, do we? The angry man looks like he wants to go over there and be the hell out of him, but the educated man suddenly speaks

dialogues.speaker: EDUCATED MAN
dialogues.text: I believe the pertinent question is, where is the Foundation?

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Help is on the way. It has to be!

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: And what if it isnвЂ™t? Pritcher watches Bayta closely.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if the Foundation doesnвЂ™t know what happened here? What if no one knows? That means weвЂ™re on our own. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Young woman, thatвЂ™s preposterous.

dialogues.speaker: EDUCATED MAN
dialogues.text: I agree. The equation could not fail to alert the Foundation to a galactic event of this magnitude. That priest crosses himself:

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Praise Seldon. Several of the others cross themselves the same way. Repe

dialogues.speaker: OTHERS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Praise Seldon. The drunk raises up his glass.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MAN
dialogues.text: Praise Seldon!

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY MAN
dialogues.text: Shut up, you-- The woman who has been walking the lobby like a zombie st and extends her arm. Points.

dialogues.speaker: SHOCKED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Look. Everyone turns. Through the broken windows we see a group SOLDIERS MARCHING IN PERFECT FORMATION. They stop in fron of one of the other buildings. Everybody moves to the windows to watch. The soldiers ent Within moments the FRIGHTENED PEOPLE inside the building forced out into the street, and the soldiers march them a They pass under a street lamp...and disappear into the ni No one can find anything to say. Everyone slowly returns their places. Finally we get:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Why did they take those people?

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MAN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t worry, darling. IвЂ™m sure we'll find out soon enough. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He quickly refills his glass. CanвЂ™t get drunk fast enou Bayta steps forward and says:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: We canвЂ™t just sit here and wait for our turn. No one speaks. No one even looks at her, as if embarrasse They know whatвЂ™s coming next.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to do something. Fight. She looks around for someone, anyone, who shows any respo at all, and then sees Pritcher. Bayta takes a chance on h

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you say, Mister--?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Pritcher. Some of the others turn to see how heвЂ™ll respond. Pritc looks around the room. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I say we should all try and get some rest. And Pritcher turns and walks out of the lobby. The angry chuckles, derisively. The disappointed Bayta watches him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER makes his way down a slightly damaged corridor. walks with a measured pace, not too fast, not too slow. I almost as if his entire body is trained to give away noth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER enters his hotel room. The window is broken, and there are spaces on the walls where the pictures have fal He walks across to the window. Pritcher looks out. Behind him the BRIEFCASE resting on t table OPENS AUTOMATICALLY revealing the SUPERCOMPUTER wit

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Have you contacted Terminus? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Not yet. Hyper-channel is blocked.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Send a message via subspace.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: You know how long that will take--

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: (starting to dictate) Captain Hans Pritcher, Department of Information, supplemental report as follows: minor political unrest predicted for planet Haven has been seriously underestimated. He looks at the computer. Thinks. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Planet has been seized by unknown quantity code name Mule. Nature of attack suggests military strategist of unparalleled ability...or with methods as yet unknown. Pritcher turns back to the window. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Future of this world is of lesser importance to questions revolving around the failure of the equation to accurately predict this event. Etcetera etcetera. You finish it.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Message sent. Should I prepare for immediate departure? Pritcher hesitates. Then says it:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: What did I just say?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: You said вЂњno.вЂќ Are you feeling ill? 18. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m fine.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Perhaps you impacted your head. Pritcher gives it a nasty look.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May I remind you regulations are quite clear on the matter. We should return to Foundation immediately.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The odds of our getting off this planet decrease exponentially after the first 24 hours of occupation--

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: We're staying.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: I am going to have to record this incident, you know. Pritcher stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have never risked your life before. Why now? (short pause) Pritcher.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? Pritcher turns around, surprised. He doesnвЂ™t answer. Ju looks back out the window. From his room he can see throu a big jagged hole in the roof exposing the lobby...and BA cur TO: INT. EBLINGвЂ™S BEDROOM -- MORNING EBLING MIS is sleeping quite peacefully. He opens his eye sees Foundation AGENTS standing around his bed, and SCREA  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING pulls his robe tight over his pajamas. He looks li an old college professor. Wishes he was still in bed. He leads the grim AGENTS through a sterile high-tech passage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide security door opens. EBLING and the Foundation AGE step onto a PERSONAL TRANSPORT and the machine speeds the down the weird mathematical corridors of the SELDON EQUAT The numbers and symbols stretch endlessly in every direct TECHNICIANS wearing high-tech bodysuits, seen earlier, pa their designated zones recording any changes in the equat The floors are invisible so everyone appears to be floati inside mathematics. The agents are looking a bit...nauseo

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: It gets to everyone the first time. If youвЂ™re going to be sick, try to use the bags please. He gestures at the SICK BAGS hanging on the console. Work the controls. The transport begins to rise, quickly takin them up to the highest levels. Ebling still views the Seldon equation with wide-eyed won

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look around, gentlemen. Grasp the wonder of a mathematical proof that began solving itself 1,000 years ago, and has never stopped running. They continue to quickly rise.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In all that time we have learned so very little. It is a common misconception that we understand precisely how and why the Seldon Equation does what it does. Now Ebling stops the transport.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are, in fact, little more than glorified custodians. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They step off the machine. Ebling leads the group down a mathematical corridor. He searches for a particular secti

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the present. Everything beyond is, of course, the future. Several levels above, we can see the end of the equation. is still solving itself -- symbols appearing out of thin Ebling finds what we wants. Indicates a particular sequen

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, here we go, yes. The planet Haven. So what?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: We lost contact with the system several days ago.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Impossible. There is a BEEP. A CHANGE IN THE EQUATION occurs in front them. A common sequence is replaced by a STRANGE NEW SYMB

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s odd. HavenвЂ™t seen that one before-- Suddenly the equation begins to transform all around them a frightening rate. ItвЂ™s like the system just went tota berserk. THEY ARE INSIDE A RAGING STORM OF NUMBERS. And n a huge chunk of the equation abruptly DISAPPEARS. The age lose their balance and fall over. The stunned Ebling star at the EMPTY WHITE SPACE up above their heads and all aro

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s going on? Professor...? Ebling can barely get it out.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: It would appear, gentlemen, that our future has just been erased. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS march through a city in ruins. So many soldiers. Their faces are still hidden beneath battle helmets. BAYT moves cautiously down a street, trying to look inconspicu (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A weak OLD MAN trips and stumbles chasing after a party o soldiers, calling out a name:

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Azi, Azi, Azi. Where is my boy? He canвЂ™t keep up with them, but another line of soldier marches past, and he follows. OLD MAN (CONTвЂ™D) Azi, Azi, Azi? Bayta watches him. She looks up. Sees HAUNTED FACES peeki out from the shattered windows along the street. She trie to meet their gaze but the people pull back into the shad Bayta is almost trampled by MORE SOLDIERS. She jumps back Sees a STREET VENDOR watching.

dialogues.speaker: STREET VENDOR
dialogues.text: More soldiers every day. His cart is broken and barely stocked. The man offers her piece of bruised FRUIT. He gives her a creepy smile, like knows something that we donвЂ™t: STREET VENDOR (CONTвЂ™D) More of them...and less of us. Bayta backs away from him. Starts to walk faster and fast She reaches a large intersection and tries to make her wa across, but in the middle of the roadway she suddenly sto looking dizzy. Bayta tries to clear her head. Looks aroun Everyone in the intersection is stopped dead in their tra Batya watches a WOMAN IN RAGGED CLOTHES drop to the groun Now a MAN. A whole GROUP. Bayta looks confused, and then her legs give out. She drops. Bayta hits the pavement har She GASPS for breath. Scared. BAYTAвЂ™S P.O.V. The sky overhead is heavy with smoke. Sh canвЂ™t move. There is RUNNING. Someone is coming closer closer. Now a SOLDIER enters the frame. Stares down at he He studies Bayta, then moves on. Soldiers are running through the intersection, from body body, as if looking for someone. They stand at attention as a SMALL FLYER descends from ab (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now at last we see THE MULE. His true identity is hidden beneath the shimmering LAYERS FORCEFIELD that make up his body armor, but we can see th there is a man inside, his FEATURES BLURRED and lost, lik some creepy technological ghost. The Mule is always accompanied by an unnerving electrical HUM. He steps from the flyer. The fields shift and CRACKL A soldier runs to him. Salutes.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: No sign of the escaped prisoner, sir. The Mule seems to sense something. Turns and looks at Bay She is still lying helpless on the pavement, unable to mo but she hears the growing HUM of the forcefields as the M approaches. Her eyes widen as: BAYTAвЂ™S P.O.V. The Mule stands over her, and now he mov closer. His eerie undefined face is only inches away. Bay looks right into his forcefield and sees her own TERRIFIE REFLECTION staring back at her. His voice emanates from inside the fields in DISTORTED wa

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: You are not indigenous to this place. Tell the Foundation that I am coming for them. Tell them I am the Mule... He reaches a hand toward her. Bayta tries to move but can THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) Tell them only the dead have seen the end of war. He touches her. HORRIFYING IMAGES rush through BaytaвЂ™s invading her, terrorizing her. Suffering and death. Her body convulses. She YELLS OUT. And sees that the Mule is GONE. Bayta can move. Slowly the people on the road begin to st Bayta rolls onto her side. Watches the soldiers march awa And now she sees something new. LONG TWISTED FINGERS are protruding from a SEWER in the r Bayta watches. She tries to make sense of what sheвЂ™s se (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The fingers grasp the rusty metal grate, trying to wrench open. Something is down in the sewers struggling to get o She crawls to the hole. Looks: BAYTAвЂ™S P.O.V. Through the grate Bayta glimpses a CREAT HIDDEN IN THE SHADOWS. She startles it. The thing release its grip and drops out of view. Bayta stares into the darkness. She considers her options. No way does Bayta want to go d there. She opens the sewer cover and slips beneath the ci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sewers are a dark, foul, inhospitable maze. BAYTA cli down the metal ladder and steps into an obscene river. Sh doesnвЂ™t know which way it went.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re the one theyвЂ™re looking for, arenвЂ™t you? Hello? I know youвЂ™re down here-- She detects movement and stops. The strange thing, whatev it is, hangs back in the deep recesses. But its eyes catc the light. Bayta moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My name is Bayta. W-whatвЂ™s yours? The creature continues to move along the wall, hiding its A gravelly little croak comes:

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t know your name? A sudden burst of odd LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: He calls me вЂњMagnifico.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Who calls you that?

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: The Mule does. To mock me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Why is he looking for you? The eyes burn with hate in the dark. That voice grows ang

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Why do you think? To find me! To start the hurt! Bayta lost track of the creature. She moves deeper into t sewer trying to follow the voice.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: He tortures you?

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes. She turns at the sound. Follows.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Why does he torture you?

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Because IвЂ™ve seen it.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Seen what?

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Seen his face! The creature is right beside her. Bayta stops. Reaches ou

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Can I see your face?

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: It comes out of the dark like a growl. Bayta canвЂ™t help tense up. Still she stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not going anywhere until you step into the light.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t want to see me.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Yes I do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ll frighten you. Terrify you.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Will you?

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes! 1IвЂ™11 kill you!

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: (softer) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Because if you were dangerous... IвЂ™d already be dead. Bayta stands there. Arm extended. A trembling hand with long skinny fingers reaches out of blackness. Slowly it takes her hand, and now MAGNIFICO steps into the light. He is ugly and deformed...but not a monst Magnifico smaller. She looks is short. His twisted spine makes him appear even His face is aged but he acts like a frightened boy. at him with compassion. ItвЂ™s not what he expected.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to take you somewhere, Magnifico. You want to come?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: (cautious) Where?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Out of the sewer. And then, if weвЂ™re lucky, to a planet at the edge of the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: And you want to take me there?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: So you can tell everyone what you know about the Mule. Magnifico looks like heвЂ™s in pain, or remembers being i pain. He jerks a little and:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Will there be places to hide?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You wonвЂ™t need to hide anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Yes I will. And you too.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Then we'll hide together. He thinks about it, very unsure. Now FOOTSTEPS echo through the sewer. They see the DISTOR SHADOWS of pursuing soldiers spreading over the tunnel wa

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s coming! Magnifico is one second away from fleeing into the dark n to be seen again. She knows it.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (talking fast) I need you to hold onto my hand, and not let go. You understand? (short pause, and trying: ) If you let go IвЂ™1l be all alone. He looks at her. Some part of him responds, and he holds previously undiscovered courage flashing across his ignob face. He takes a brave stance.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be scared, Magnifico will hold your hand. And they run off down the tunnel. They donвЂ™t get far before the walls fill with MORE SHAD blocking their escape. Bayta and Magnifico look around. S another passage and hurry inside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They find a ladder to the surface. They start to ascend b see SOLDIERS STANDING GUARD ON THE STREET above. They duc out of sight, and keep on moving. They emerge into a larger tunnel and bolt across the open space for the far side. A group of soldiers hears them, a for a moment, Bayta and Magnifico are bathed in bright LI They run inside another opening. They find a second ladder leading to the surface, but itв guarded just like the first one. The sound of FOOTSTEPS grows louder as the soldiers close Bayta and Magnifico race down a final tunnel. They reach GATE and pull on the rusty bars. It is locked. They are trapped. They see the SILHOUETTE OF A MAN approaching down the cen of the tunnel. He is backlit by the flashlights from the search party following close behind. We cannot see his fa Magnifico starts to panic. Pulls wildly on the gate. Bayt looks for the locking mechanism. And then she sees it. On the other side of the gate is an extremely long tunnel, and down at the far end, almost to small to see, is a tiny KEYHOLE. BaytaвЂ™s face loses all hope. Magnifico stops fighting. slides to the floor, WHIMPERING. THE SOUNDS OF PURSUIT ECHO THROUGH THE TUNNEL. Like a who army is coming for them. The silhouetted man moves closer We still canвЂ™t make him out.... Bayta turns to face the man and He steps closer. ItвЂ™s PRITCHER. Bayta canвЂ™t believe her eyes. Pritcher doesnвЂ™t bother hellos. He moves past her, looks through the gate, and se his BRIEFCASE down on the ledge. A light on the edge of the case BLINKS as the computer ta

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Please remain calm while we initiate your rescue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bayta watches Pritcher pull out a STRANGE GUN. He extends the barrel to make it longer, looks through the gate agai and makes the barrel even longer. COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) Distance to the locking mechanism is seventy meters. Bayta watches him work and the truth is beginning to sink

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: How did you get here? Are you following me? He pulls out a little SOFT BLOB of some kind of material, molds it into the shape of a bullet -- and loads the cham Pritcher aims through the gate at the keyhole on the far

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you?! He doesnвЂ™t answer her. Just concentrates on making the Bayta turns and sees the LIGHTS GETTING CLOSER. The soldi are almost here. Not much time. Pritcher stares down the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: As a point of interest, we will be apprehended in approximately twenty seconds. The soldiers are nearly on them.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Shoot it now! Pritcher stares down the barrel. And he FIRES. The bullet speeds down the long tunnel INTO THE KEYHOLE. The soft bullet material SPLATTERS inside th lock, and triggers the tumblers. The gate CLICKS and swings open. They run through the open gate and disappear down the tun  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sewer cover swings open. PRITCHER, BAYTA, and MAGNIFICO climb out into a narrow alley. Look around. Magnifico is clinging tightly to BaytaвЂ™s hand. They run down the length of the alley. Look over the stre They see a group of SOLDIERS standing watch at either end the block. They bolt for the alley directly across the ro The soldiers are looking the other way and donвЂ™t notice They race down the alley and run right into MORE SOLDIERS Before anyone can raise a weapon Pritcher drops his BRIEF and attacks. He moves with an almost mathematical precisi A soldier grabs Bayta from behind. The frightened Magnifico wants to run and hide. But he se Bayta being assaulted, and canвЂ™t. Finally he lets go a SCREAM. He charges at the soldier but is easily pushed aw Magnifico lands by that briefcase:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: May I suggest you pick me up and propel me in a broad lateral arc. Magnifico picks up the case -- and swings it savagely. Th blow knocks off the soldierвЂ™s battle helmet and he goes Magnifico just stands there, BREATHING rapidly. He looks terrified. Surprised. Thrilled. Pritcher drops the final soldier. Bayta steps closer to the one who attacked her, like she doesnвЂ™t understand what sheвЂ™s seeing, and suddenly sh The soldierвЂ™s face. It is TORAN. Pritcher hurries to another soldier and rips off the helm Underneath is the face of an OLD MAN. He removes another sees a TEEN-AGE GIRL. He pulls off a third to reveal the head of a BALDING HEAVY-SET MIDDLE-AGED MAN. Under the la helmet he sees a matronly woman who must be someoneвЂ™s M

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They were turned. Pritcher looks at Magnifico, so intensely it frightens hi He backs away as he explains: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Mule reaches inside your head and twists everything around, and when heвЂ™s done, you belong to him. Bayta gently holds ToranвЂ™s head. He looks like the man knew except for that uniform.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was turned. Suddenly ToranвЂ™s eyes open... Bayta looks at him, hopefully. She opens her mouth to say something. And he puts his hands around her neck. Squeeze ToranвЂ™s face is filled with rage and hate as he chokes She tries to get his hands off her neck, but canвЂ™t, sta into that twisted version of a face she used to know so w Toran rolls on top of her and Pritcher tries to pull him off. He hits Toran several tim and finally breaks him loose. Bayta GASPS for air. Toran runs at them, like a wild anim A SHOT rings out and a RED HOLE appears in his back. Bayt SCREAMS as Toran goes down. MORE SHOTS ring out and the walls all around them erupt. Pritcher is GRAZED BY A BULL SOLDIERS are running into the alley from the street SHOOT Pritcher pulls Bayta to her feet. She tries to fight for moment, wanting to stay, trying to get to Toran, but he p her away and finally she runs. The soldiers are gaining ground. Still FIRING. Pritcher leads Bayta and Magnifico toward a RUN-DOWN OLD SHACK. Th hurry inside, as if hoping to find a place to hide. The o door with a broken hinge BANGS awkwardly shut. Moments pa The soldiers approach the shack, cautiously. Weapons rais They methodically surround the building. Still no sound o movement from inside. Slowly they begin to close the circ A soldier reaches the door and The shack BURSTS APART as a SMALL SPACECRAFT ROCKETS THRO THE ROOF rising toward the sky on a trail of SMOKE AND FL  32. INT. PRITCHERвЂ™S SHIP -- DAY PRITCHER works the controls inside a small cockpit. BAYTA belted in behind him along with a wide-eyed MAGNIFICO. Th BRIEFCASE is open and sits in a special cavity relaying d

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Systems are go. Firing booster in five, four, three, two, one. There is a DEAFENING ROAR and everyone is forced back int their seats. It looks painful. Through the cockpit window we watch the sky dissolve away. Now they begin to see STA The booster rockets cut out and the ship falls SILENT. Th are floating above the planet. Finally they have a moment to rest. They look beaten down all of them, especially Bayta, just staring out at the st Then comes the unwelcome BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a proximity alert.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Hard to say. They look through the window. Nothing for a moment. Then can see that something is floating closer, tumbling slowl end-over-end. Gradually it takes the shape of a human bei It is a BODY horrifically embalmed by the pressures of sp

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Oh no... Pritcher, Bayta, and Magnifico can only watch as the corp drifts toward them striking the cockpit with a ghastly TH MORE CORPSES are visible drifting toward the ship. They a sailing in a sea of the dead. The bodies continue to hit the hull with a THUNK THUNK TH

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Can we make the jump?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Not until we clear the debris field. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Magnifico grows more unsettled with every strike on the h

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Try and relax. The good news is theyвЂ™1l have a hard time finding us in here. Suddenly the universe turns red as an ENERGY BEAM slices the bow of the ship like a giant knife. The vessel shudde

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: They are beginning their search. ANOTHER ENERGY BEAM cuts through space. Even closer to th Magnifico panics. CRIES OUT. Fights with the straps of hi chair. He stumbles from the cockpit into the rear cargo b Quickly Bayta releases herself.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l get him. ANOTHER ENERGY BEAM cuts through space. Even closer to th Bayta enters the small hold and sees Magnifico huddled in corner. The ship ROCKS. She stumbles forward. He sees her

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: You lied! ThereвЂ™s nowhere to hide! You lied to me! ANOTHER ENERGY BEAM cuts through space. Even closer to th Bayta almost reaches him when:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Incoming. A WALL OF ENERGY appears between Bayta and Magnifico. It strange. They donвЂ™t understand it at first, staring at another through a shimmering red wall. And then realizati If HAS SLICED THROUGH THE HULL. COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) Hull is compromised. Activating containment field. The energy beam disappears and: The cargo hold SPLITS into two halves. Emergency FORCEFIE activate locking in the atmosphere, but Bayta can only wa helplessly as MagnificoвЂ™s small piece of the ship drift (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He screams out for her but she canвЂ™t hear him. Bayta lo around frantically. Sees a TETHER LINE. She thinks about for only a moment. Takes the end. Ties it around her wais

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: (to the computer) Take the controls! Pritcher bolts out of his seat and starts toward the rear and for the first time something he sees actually shocks Bayta is running for open space. She drags the elastic tether behind her. Pritcher jumps a tries to catch the line, but his fingers miss by mere inc He can only watch as Bayta runs: PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) No! Bayta leaps through the containment field and SAILS ACROS SPACE. She floats past the petrified corpses of the dead Magnifico stares in wide-eyed wonder. She drifts toward h Bayta breaks his forcefield and lands inside his tiny sec of the ship. BLOOD TRAILS FROM HER EYES AND EARS. The vessels in her cheeks have burst in the vacuum. She looks like sheвЂ™s passed through hell, and yet, her voice is g

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Hide in my arms. Magnifico buries himself in her body. Bayta holds him tig Pritcher yanks on the tether and Bayta and Magnifico sail back across the void through a s of corpses. ONE OF THE DRIFTING BODIES seems to watch the pass, staring with horrific eyes, its mouth open grotesqu Magnifico never moves. Just holds on. Bayta looks like sh is not going to survive when They break through the forcefield...and drop to the floor the sliced cargo hold. Pritcher hurries over. Looks at he And yells toward the cockpit:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Get us out of here! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The small ship jumps across space. Through the windows we watch the galaxy BLUR and a NEW SET OF STARS takes its pl

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Magnifico cradles the unconscious Bayta. He gently caress her bruised cheek, and carefully sets one hair back in pl

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Did you see how she flew? She flew across the universe, just to save me. Pritcher injects her arm with the contents of an odd SYRI Magnifico watches him work.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (innocently) Has anybody ever done that for you? Pritcher just shakes his head. Finishes his work. Finally

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a lucky man. Magnifico watches him walk off. It looks like that had an impact on him, like no one ever called him lucky before, even referred to him as a man. Pritcher reenters the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Ready for the next jump.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Go. The small ship jumps across space. Through the windows we watch the galaxy BLUR and a NEW SET OF STARS takes its pl Magnifico is still thinking about what Pritcher said. He looks down at Bayta cradled in his arms and pulls her clo

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Bayta opens her eyes. Sees where she is. Magnifico is lyi beside her, sleeping like a baby. We have never seen him peaceful. Very carefully Bayta slips out from under his a She covers him with a BLANKET. Bayta moves toward the cockpit and steps inside. Pritcher at the controls. He knows that she entered but says nothi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Thank you. For getting us off the planet.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re welcome. Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Yes. Suddenly, she looks impatient:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that thatвЂ™s out of the way... can I ask you a fucking question?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (angry) How did the Foundation let this happen? You people are supposed to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s review what we do know. Pritcher hits a button on the control panel. PICTURES AND SURVEILLANCE FOOTAGE OF BAYTA appear floating in the cock PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) YouвЂ™re a Foundation-er by birth. Real name is Bayta Darrel. You are a Level 4 historian, and a member of the Seldon opposition -.-the so-called вЂњunderground.вЂќ Pritcher turns. Looks at her. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Until a few weeks ago, you were being held for questioning on suspicion of conspiring against the Foundation. Bayta watches surveillance footage of her and Toran. They look like theyвЂ™re escaping from some kind of prison fac PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) You escaped from detention along with a fellow subversive you met behind bars. Since then the two (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) of you have maintained a platonic relationship while masquerading as a married couple on honeymoon. Bayta plops in a seat. Waits. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Then the bombs started dropping.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Okay. So you were following me.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: You seem to have a talent for attracting conflict. You are dynamic, vigorous, and lively.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Are you asking me out?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I thought if I followed you around youвЂ™d eventually stumble into something interesting.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: What the hell kind of spy are you?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I collect information. Right now your little friend back there is the only source of information we have regarding the Mule. She watches him. He goes on.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s developed an attachment to you. ThatвЂ™s good. But it means IвЂ™m going to need your help.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: My help.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: To awaken the Foundation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (skeptical) You think it needs to be вЂњawakened?вЂќ From what?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: The Foundation never acts unless told to by the equation. If the equation is no longer predicting the future weвЂ™re in grave danger. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Why Mr. Pritcher, you sound like an intellectual subversive.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: For the time being, yes. The computer abruptly speaks:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: We are prepped for final jump.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Go. (back to Bayta) That monster didnвЂ™t invade Haven for wealth or territory. He is taking the population and making an army -- and now we know why. A subspace transmission arrived while you were sleeping. The small ship jumps across space. Through the windows we watch the galaxy BLUR and a NEW SET OF STARS takes its pl And now, there is a planet. Pritcher and Bayta see TERMIN

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Mule has just declared war on the Foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of Terminus is barren and hostile. Like a lar desolate moon. But it holds a population that lives in th best comfort high technology can offer -- a DOMED FUTURIS CITY that fulfills the promise of one thousand years of h  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR stands at a podium addressing a large counci chamber filled with empty seats. WORKERS are visible on t perimeter readying the chamber for some official celebrat

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: ...and so as we commemorate the end of the thousand year plan, we recall the words of Hari Seldon... He sees EBLING MIS step up and: MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) Ah, Ebling! YouвЂ™re just in time to hear my speech. Take a seat. Ebling looks like he doesnвЂ™t like him but wants to play

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor. Right now IвЂ™d like to discuss an important matter with you, if I may?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: An important matter? Oh, youвЂ™re talking about that little glitch with the equation.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not sure if вЂњglitchвЂќ is the term I would use.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: I was told that the equation has returned to normal.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Well, yes, it has--

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Then IвЂ™d say that glitch was an appropriate term for a brief technical problem that has been resolved, wouldnвЂ™t you?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I suppose so--

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Good. IвЂ™m glad we settled that. Now stand here while I check the lighting. I donвЂ™t want to look washed out during the broadcast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ebling doesnвЂ™t want to do it, but as the Mayor hurries the stage, he takes his place at the podium. Now EblingвЂ voice is magnified by the mike:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Sir, the equation underwent a massive system failure a moment after the appearance of a new construct.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: A new construct?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (explaining) A complex representation that is constructed from other simpler representations. A new symbol I havenвЂ™t seen before. Mayor Indbar stops backing up. He stares at Ebling on sta

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a learned man, Professor, but no one can know every single inch of the equation. Ebling is getting excited. He steps to the side of the sm podium and gestures animatedly:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, of course. But thatвЂ™s just it! This symbol has never come up before. ItвЂ™s never been catalogued. Never appeared once in a thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Uh, would you move back behind the podium, please?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: What? Oh, sorry. Ebling moves back in place. The Mayor does not look pleas

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: You look washed out.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: About this symbol-- The Mayor stares up at the ceiling. Tries to see the ligh (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Did anyone else see it?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Did anyone see this mysterious symbol, except for you? Ebling doesnвЂ™t like where this is going. He takes a pie PAPER from his pocket. DRAWS A STRANGE SYMBOL. Holds it u

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: This is it, sir. As closely as I can remember it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: And what do you think it means?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I believe it may represent an individual.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: That would be odd, wouldnвЂ™t it?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (encouraged) Yes, sir. Very much so. Ebling descends the stage to get away from that mike. Spe in hushed tones as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Psycho-history concerns itself with the actions of large groups of people, whole societies, never individuals. ItвЂ™s possible that an individual has arisen for whom the equation is unable to adjust. Now admittedly, it would have to be an extraordinary individual--

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: (dismissive) I doubt extraordinary men exist in this day and age. Ebling stops for a moment. He watches the Mayor walk ahea (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Excuse me for saying so, Mayor, but hasnвЂ™t war been declared?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re talking about this вЂњmuleвЂќ character. My dear Professor, there is a great deal of space between us and the planet Haven. Now we see an OLD ORNATE VAULT. ItвЂ™s like an ancient re MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) They say Seldon himself would walk out of this vault, back in the early days, and address the Foundation at times of crisis.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I know the stories.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Do you believe them? Ebling doesnвЂ™t answer lightly:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: With my whole heart and soul.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a man of solid faith. I admire that, but I myself donвЂ™t believe a word of it. Mayor Indbar turns and places his hand on EblingвЂ™s shou MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) Hari Seldon was a great man... but still only a man. There is no need anymore for old myths. The reality around us is proof enough. We made it. We saved the human race from extinction. He looks at the vault again. MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) I donвЂ™t believe that Seldon is going to step out of that vault any more than I think some kind of extraordinary superman is on his way here to destroy mankind. EblingвЂ™s time is clearly up: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) Is the equation working?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Yes--

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: And what is it telling us to do about this вЂњmule?вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: (pleased) Then stop worrying, and start enjoying yourself. Ebling watches the Mayor walk off. MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) This is a time for celebration!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA and MAGNIFICO wait outside a door. Magnifico obviou does not want to go through there.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Maybe they donвЂ™t want to see me. Maybe we should go. Maybe-- Bayta reassures him, with a touch.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: This is why we came. Remember? Magnifico nods his head a little.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l be right beside you. The door opens, and PRITCHER steps out. He gestures them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO sits in an imposing chair with a strange APPARA attached to his head. He looks nervous. BAYTA is beside h holding his hand. PRITCHER stands a distance away from th A group of grim INTERROGATORS stare at Magnifico coldly, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Is it true that you have been a prisoner of the Mule?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Y-yes. Behind Magnifico, IMAGES FROM HIS MIND appear, a playback multiple memories going at once. ItвЂ™s crazy visual insa From the point of view of a prisoner, we are THROWN INTO DARK CELL. Laughed at by cruel GUARDS. Repeatedly TORTURE And now we see THE MULE, that ghostly suggestion of a hum being hidden under his forcefields. He oversees the tortu

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: He hides his identity behind a personal forcefield.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: But you have seen his true face with your own eyes?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 3
dialogues.text: What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t remember.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t remember.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: What does he look like? Magnifico jerks in the chair, as if in physical pain. He terrified. Bayta holds on tighter. She wants to object, b suddenly, MagnificoвЂ™s spasms subside. He stares out at as if in some trance, possessed by his own fearsome memor

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: He is a man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Like us?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: No. Not like you.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: Describe him.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: He is tall. He stands above me like a giant. 45. We see a DISTORTED IMAGE of an impossibly large man, so t his face is lost in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 3
dialogues.text: Would you say he was six feet tall?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: Seven feet tall?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: What is he doing to you?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s putting his arm around my throat, and picking me up. He is holding me up with one hand ...and I canвЂ™t breathe. The distorted image is lifting Magnifico.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: Can you see his face?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: (almost a sob) No.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 3
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: My eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: And what happens next? Closer and closer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: (yelling) He makes me open them!

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 2
dialogues.text: What do you see? As Magnifico recalls the memory, a PORTRAIT FORMS behind

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I see inside his head.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: You see inside his head? Are you speaking figuratively? Magnifico LAUGHS. Very creepy.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Then what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I mean I see inside his head. He has no skull. His brains. I see his brains. The interrogators share a surprised look. Pritcher watche them. Bayta squeezes his hand:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His skin is torn away. I can see the muscles underneath. He has no lips. I see his teeth even when his mouth is closed. The portrait of the Mule forms for all to see, an IMAGE O ASTOUNDING HORROR, constantly adjusting as Magnifico goes

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (getting upset) I see two holes where his eyes should be. He has no eyes, but he can see me. He has no eyes but he can see! Magnifico jerks in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (panicking now) ItвЂ™s death to look at his face!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH DEATH DEATH--
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The lead interrogator works a control panel, and the imag disappears. Magnifico slumps. The interrogator gestures a UNIFORMED MEN step over. They take Magnifico from the cha He just goes limp in their arms. Bayta shares a look with Pritcher. Follows them out. The door slides shut again an

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Captain. What is the point of showing us the exaggerated memories of a damaged mind?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not sure his account can be dismissed so easily. They look at him, skeptically. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Consider this. The Mule commands an army -- and yet he conceals his true appearance, even from his own men. Why give up the advantage of personal leadership? They seem willing to go along. PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) The reason may be that personal contact would reveal a fact it is vitally important not to reveal.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: The Mule is not a human being. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE marches down a long corridor accompanied by the unsettling HUM of his forcefields. We canвЂ™t see his tru self through the fields, just the eerie suggestion of a b cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER doesnвЂ™t give the INTERROGATORS a chance to sto (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I suspect he is a mutation, and based on the ease with which he took the planet Haven, a highly successful one. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE enters a command center filled with his SOLDIERS They look like an army of zombies. Their faces have no expression. They move around the ship like human automato cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER gestures as he speaks:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: During the attack, and despite my training, I experienced a feeling of overwhelming panic. I think the Mule can trigger emotions over relatively large distances. Make you feel terror or despair. The INTERROGATORS fidget uncomfortably as they listen to

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At close range it appears he can access top-level brain waves. Make you see something or forget something. Cause a memory to be associated with pain, as we have witnessed in this room today. He steps closer. Keeps at it: PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) Given time I believe he can alter neurological patterns and rewrite minds. IвЂ™ve seen normal men and women converted into bloodthirsty soldiers. Magnifico called them вЂњturnedвЂќ -- as good a term as any. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE steps up to an enormous viewport and looks out o his FLEET OF SHIPS, the assembled vessels of an entire wo cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERROGATORS exchange glances. They listen to PRITCH

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: By now, we have to assume that the entire population of Haven has been affected. The Mule is free to move from planet to planet assimilating even greater numbers into the single largest military force ever conceived. Pritcher makes his final play:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can a genetic accident be taken into account by the Plan? How could Seldon have foreseen this? His words hang in the air like the most outrageous blasph

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It took us a thousand years to build the Foundation. If we do nothing, it will take the Mule an hour to lay it in ruins.... They just stare, for a long time, and say nothing. Finall

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATOR 1
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain. We will consider all of the evidence presented here today before making our recommendation to the council. After the high drama of PritcherвЂ™s speech, this pat res is decidedly under-whelming. Pritcher realizes. He is don cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE looks out over his fleet. An expressionless OFFI steps up. Salutes. His voice has no pitch or tone. Spooky (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: The world has been processed, sir. Those unfit for duty are being returned to the planet, as you ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE UNFIT FOR DUTY are packed tight into airlocks. The are too old, or too young, or too feeble. The lucky ones. They have been forced so close together no one can move, itвЂ™s clear nobody would move even if they could. They l hypnotized. They stand there with blank smiles on their faces, too many to count. Thousands. HUNDREDS OF THOUSAND Airlocks on every ship are packed with blank, smiling peo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlocks open and COUNTLESS HUMAN BODIES hurl into sp We are far away. We have to be far away to take in the sh numbers. Genocide has never been so instantaneous . Swarm of human beings tumble into orbit around Haven, their cor forming an obscene terrible RING around the planet far be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE watches the ring form. We listen to the familiar sound of his forcefield as he turns and walks off the bri cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER, BAYTA, and MAGNIFICO ride an elevator. Magnific holds BaytaвЂ™s hand, as usual, looking up at her like a

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: To see a man. You and I are going to stay with him for a while.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Will he be mean, like those other people?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: No. IвЂ™m sure heвЂ™ll be very happy to see us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The elevator opens revealing the face of EBLING MIS. He s Bayta standing there and scowls:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: They let you out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I escaped.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Well donвЂ™t sound so proud of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER, BAYTA, and MAGNIFICO step inside what must be t most bookish -- but also the most disheveled -- home arou EBLING offers his hand and says:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: You must be Magnifico. I am very pleased to meet you. Magnifico stares at the offered hand, perplexed, then pla his balled-up fist into EblingвЂ™s palm. They shake like

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why donвЂ™t you take a look around. Magnifico moves through the place looking at everything, books and the diagrams, and playing with the strange GADG

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Are you sure about this, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Quite sure, Captain. I think I can be of some use to him, and he may still have secrets locked up inside that head of his. He looks them over as if to gauge:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I take it today did not go well.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Ha.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Not very well. No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Try not to judge them too harshly. (for Bayta) ItвЂ™s impossible to learn what one thinks one already knows. Bayta rolls her eyes. Ebling sees that Magnifico is neari a tall stand holding some kind of strange MUSICAL INSTRUM

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Good boy. Now pick it up-- Magnifico picks up the instrument. Looks at it. ItвЂ™s an little device with a single knob, and certain to attract

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, what have you got there? Ebling walks over. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s called a visi-sonar. fry it. Magnifico stares at it, uncertain. He places his finger o the lone knob. A SINGLE PLAINTIVE NOTE OF MUSIC is heard, and his eyes widen in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Where did that come from?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: From you, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I have music inside me? Ebling looks at him, with great warmth, and gently explai

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: We all do. Every living creature. The sounds and songs of life. It is said the best players can strike notes that are never heard by the ears, but go directly to the soul. Magnifico is clearly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This will be yours to keep while youвЂ™re here. Magnifico happily nods his head and ambles off, like a ki with a toy. Ebling is pleased. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (back to Pritcher) I have always believed in the therapeutic value of-- He watches the elevator doors slide SHUT. Pritcher has ju left. Bayta tries to look as if she doesnвЂ™t care either

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not much for good-byes, is he?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Not so big with hellos either.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: You like him.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (as if appalled) What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Your overly-calculated body language intended to convince me that you donвЂ™t like him. Bayta doesnвЂ™t know how to position her body now. Resort

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Damn it. Magnifico touches the instrument again, and hears another note. Tries again. Ebling and Bayta move onto the terrace The view is stunning. We see a great deal of the city, an beyond the enclosure, the grim moon-like terrain of Termi

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ve become a common criminal.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s nothing common about it.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: What would your parents say?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (defiant) I donвЂ™t know. They died in a shuttle accident when I was two.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve told you all about them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: They dedicated their lives to the Seldon Plan.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: It didn't save them, did it?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: You know very well the equation doesnвЂ™t concern itself with the deaths of specific individuals.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
