dialogues.text: (getting upset) Then to hell with it! Bayta calms down. She knows that was pointless. From the other room, they can hear Magnifico PLAYING. It is tentat and clumsy, of course, not even music. But she is surpris

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s really playing that thing.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t require coordination or skill, just a kind of free- form mentality. The best players are often of low intelligence. They are discussing Magnifico in order to avoid arguing. Finally after an awkward pause:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hari Seldon will not abandon the Foundation. He has watched over us for a thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You really believe that.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Have faith.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a scientist.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Science without religion is lame --.and religion, without science, is blind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bayta is getting upset again, and that music is not helpi matters. HAUNTING EXTENDED NOTES. It is really very creep

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Is it supposed to sound like that?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I wouldnвЂ™t expect it to sound any more pleasant, seeing what kind of life that poor creature has no doubt led.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I guess the equation didnвЂ™t give a damn about him, either. Ebling looks at her. Saddened.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: How could I have failed so totally? I tried to teach you, but you hate it. The equation. The Seldon Plan. You hate too much. They realize the music has stopped. And Magnifico is ther

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Are you fighting?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Not really. Just continuing an old discussion.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: A man named Hari Seldon.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: He died for us.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s too bad. Ebling moves down to his level.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: No. No, itвЂ™s not. Do you want to see what he did? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Magnifico nods, and they start to go. But Ebling pauses f a moment before leaving the terrace. He says one last thi to Bayta, without looking back:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m glad youвЂ™re home. Bayta looks surprised and wants to respond, but canвЂ™t f the words...and then heвЂ™s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS and MAGNIFICO lie on their backs in the center the Seldon equation. It looks unusual, thatвЂ™s for sure, two of them lying there so casually, on an invisible floo floating in a universe of math:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I wanted to show you my favorite spot. From here it looks endless.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: (very impressed) And Hari Seldon gave this to you?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: He gave the equation to all of us. You too.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: No. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Because I am nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a human being.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s not so big a deal. Ebling thinks about him. Asks:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t you have a family?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: My mother threw me away. No one wants an ugly child. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnifico 57.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Where did you grow up?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: On the streets. I can find food and clothes and hide.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Then youвЂ™ve always been alone.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Yes. I used to like it, but now I like being with Bayta. looks worried. Like maybe he said the wrong thing.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Of course. I like being with her too.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Can you read these funny numbers?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Most of them. But IвЂ™m not a real psycho-historian. There are none. Only Hari Seldon truly understood how the equation works.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Why didnвЂ™t he tell someone?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: No one knows. Maybe because if we knew too much, we might mess things up. Instead we must have faith, believe in his plan, and do as the equation instructs us.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: But you think itвЂ™s broken.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m worried itвЂ™s not showing us the real future. If so we may have deviated from the intended course of human events.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Because of the Mule? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think the Mule was supposed to exist.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: (thinking it through) Then the numbers canвЂ™t tell you what will happen when he gets here.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Exactly. Very good. Magnifico smiles, proudly. Just stares up at the equation And suddenly he looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m your friend, Magnifico. You can say whatever is on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Maybe the numbers donвЂ™t want to tell you whatвЂ™s going to happen. Ebling smiles, a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Why would the equation hide the truth from the Foundation? MagnificoвЂ™s haunted face stares out at the weird mathem He wipes off EblingвЂ™s smile:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Because maybe if you knew youвЂ™d never stop screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA moves down the darkened corridor trying not to make noise. She stops at a room. The bed inside is empty. Bayta looks around. Sees MAGNIFI curled up in a ball on the floor. He is sleeping peaceful Bayta continues down the hall and reaches the study. She hears EBLING talking to himself. She looks in. Watches hi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is furiously filling a blackboard with strange numbers symbols, his mind calculating faster than his hand can wr Ebling never hears her slip past. Bayta steps into the op elevator, and takes it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA moves through the antiseptic streets of Terminus Ci She looks around to see if the coast is clear, and strang joins several OTHERS. They continue through the dark city just as clandestinely, and eventually knock on a door. Wa The door opens. They go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HEATED ARGUMENT is echoing through the abandoned spaces an unoccupied building. We move closer to the dim light a emerge into a claustrophobic space crowded with MEMBERS O THE UNDERGROUND, about a dozen or so. They all look nervo

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: You shouldnвЂ™t have come. They know you. You are endangering all of us, Bayta. A few OVER-LAPPING agreements.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Are you finished?

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: Not by a long shot.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Well let me know when youвЂ™re done because the Mule is heading this way, IвЂ™ve seen him up close, and when he gets here itвЂ™s all over for the Foundation, and for us -- for every damned thing. That doesnвЂ™t change anybodyвЂ™s mind, but it does shut

dialogues.speaker: NERVOUS WOMAN
dialogues.text: The council must be taking some kind of action.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, theyвЂ™re getting ready for their thousand year celebration. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: This city could be falling down around them and theyвЂ™d wait for the equation to tell us to duck. OVER-LAPPING comments and then Bayta gestures at a NERDY MAN, one of the small group she on the street. He activates an odd device and SCHEMATICS THE SELDON VAULT fill the air. Everybody turns and looks at Bayta, as if sheвЂ™s interru

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: These are the schematics for the Seldon vault, compliments of the Foundation archive.

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: (still irritated) Uh-huh. So what?

dialogues.speaker: SKEPTICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: People have been studying that thing for centuries. We know itвЂ™s hollow. ThereвЂ™s nothing in it.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Not yet there isnвЂ™t. No one understands. Bayta gestures at another one of her associates. A MOUSY WOMAN positions some kind of PORTABLE PROJECTOR. She turns it on and A HOLOGRAM OF HARI SELDON is sitting in the middle of the room. Everyone instinctively moves away from it. The thin looks like a real man at first, until we get a closer loo and realize it is not breathing. Not moving a single musc The Seldon Hologram sits in the chair staring straight ah Bayta brings a small MICROPHONE to her lips, with a devio smile, and carefully enunciates.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. I am Hari Seldon. After a slight delay the creepy hologram opens its mouth

dialogues.speaker: HOLOGRAM
dialogues.text: Hello. I am Hari Seldon. The words come out in the voice of an old man. A convinci illusion. She looks triumphant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: In the middle of the MayorвЂ™s speech, the vault doors will open for the first time in six hundred years, and Hari Seldon will address the Foundation. No one knows quite what to say.

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t approve this project. How long have you been working on this?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: A little over a year. Everyone is edging closer to the Hologram, hesitantly, li they expect it to move any moment. In many ways it resemb the real Hari Seldon we saw, but an idealized version of They canвЂ™t take their eyes off it. ItвЂ™s like...seeing

dialogues.speaker: NERVOUS WOMAN
dialogues.text: It looks just like him.

dialogues.speaker: SKEPTICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: How would you know if it looked like him or not?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
dialogues.text: It looks like it looks like him.

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: You really think this thing is going to work?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I would expect the return of the Messiah to cause quite a fuss... wouldnвЂ™t you? A scared woman crosses herself.

dialogues.speaker: SKEPTICAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing that for? That younger man does the same. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t even believe this guy existed and IвЂ™m still freaked. The section chief watches the reactions, considering it, irritation at Bayta forgotten:

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: You do realize that somebody is going to figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Who cares? WeвЂ™re creating a moment. A single moment can change the course of history. Bayta looks at them. On fire.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Foundation needs someone to tell it what to do. ItвЂ™s about to hear the word of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER crouches on a rooftop across the street. He is carrying his usual BRIEFCASE. He doesnвЂ™t look very plea

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Are the other units in position?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: We'll wait several minutes, and then move in.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Understood. (short pause) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: You are intending to arrest her this time, arenвЂ™t you?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Of course. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Just checking. (short pause) Because you know if you donвЂ™t I will have to alert central.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Just get ready to move out.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. (short pause) You know that I enjoy being your partner, and only speak this way when it is in your best interest.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I know. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. (short pause) For a moment, I thought you may have developed--

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t have feelings, computer.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I will remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA stands there with the other members of the UNDERGRO waiting for the section chief to make his decision. Final

dialogues.speaker: SECTION CHIEF
dialogues.text: All right. LetвЂ™s do it. Suddenly a small OBJECT BREAKS THE WINDOW and flies throu the air attaching itself to the wall. Immediately it shoo out thin TENDRILS that crisscross the room like a spider Bayta and the nerdy man drop to the floor. TWO MORE OBJEC burst through the walls and FIRE filling the space. The r of them are hopelessly ENTANGLED. The mousy woman canвЂ™t get loose. She removes a DISK fro projector and the SELDON HOLOGRAM DISAPPEARS. She manages toss it to Bayta a second before: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AN ELECTRIC PULSE passes through the wires and everyone i jolted. The group collectively slumps, hanging from the w like food for a large arachnid. The Foundation AGENTS ent Bayta and the nerdy man lift a small cover, slipping thro a HOLE in the floor. They land hard in the basement and r They reach an intersection. Share a quick look and split Bayta races through the sub-level. Sees a tunnel leading and goes for it. She reaches an exit and runs into PRITCH For a moment they look at each other without much express Then Bayta smiles. Like sheвЂ™s happy to see him. Like sh going to say hey, baby, nice to see you. She turns and ru Pritcher FIRES a smaller version of the same device we sa upstairs. The object attaches to her back, filaments quic wrap themselves around her torso, and a PULSE takes her d Bayta hits the floor. Hard. Her eyes are open, staring ou at the dirty wall and the floor, but she canвЂ™t move a m Pritcher unceremoniously picks her up and drapes her over left shoulder. Several MORE AGENTS peek through the door from outside, and see him. He gestures okay. They hurry o With his free hand Pritcher picks up his BRIEFCASE and st through the basement, Bayta hanging from him like a rag d

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: That was a very smooth arrest, sir. Congratulations. Pritcher takes a staircase heading deeper under the build COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) ShouldnвЂ™t we be going up now?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Of course. Very good, sir. I believe the prisoner is coming around. Bayta slowly begins to stir. She tries to talk, but it co out like a strange MUMBLE. She kicks her legs ineffectual Pritcher walks even deeper into the underground complex a finally stops. Lays the briefcase down. Sets Bayta uprigh (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping here? She is really pissed off and:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (mouth still numb) Jerk. Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: To question the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Oh. BaytaвЂ™s getting feeling back.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (sounding normal) So thatвЂ™s it? This is all you got? YouвЂ™re just going to go on doing your dirty little job while the galaxy goes to hell? Pritcher does not respond. Just fiddles with a small devi

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A large brain is wasted on you, Captain -- all you need is a spinal cord! Pritcher finishes his work.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At least Hari Seldon had the guts to take on the empire! You are nothing but a cowardly-- He hits a button and the cords binding her FALL AWAY. Bay stops yelling and looks down at the ropes. CanвЂ™t believ They look at each other and She realizes what heвЂ™s doing, it all snaps into place, pulls her close. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Sir? COMPUTER'S P.O.V. Through the slightly-distorted lens of computer we see Pritcher and Bayta still kissing one anot (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) I do not believe this is a proper interrogation. You leave me no choice but to initiate a priority one alarm. I regret this, sir. We hear some CLICKING. Pritcher and Bayta just keep kissi COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) That is strange. I am no longer in contact with central command. Pritcher and Bayta finally pull apart, still holding onto another, both breathing fast.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the walls down here. Your signal canвЂ™t get through. He turns to the computer with: PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) TheyвЂ™1l find you eventually.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: And what should I tell them?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: (thinking) Tell them, itвЂ™s the end of the world...and I quit.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: And what if the world does not end? What will the two of you do then? Pritcher. Pritcher takes Bayta by the hand and they run down a pass COMPUTER (CONTвЂ™D) (calling after) What will you do then? cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA kiss. It is clumsy and desperate. They fall onto the bed and look into each otherвЂ™s eyes. They again and this time donвЂ™t stop. cUT TO:  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS looks exhausted and discouraged. The study is complete disarray. HeвЂ™s been working on a long calculat and has scribbled parts of it on every available surface. looks around at the mess. Thinks. He hurries from the roo

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Bayta, wake up. I think that Magnifico was right. He opens her door and walks in:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think the equation is lying-- Ebling stops. Sees that no one is here. He looks surprise Wanders back down the hall. He moves past the other room Magnifico is no longer lying in the corner. He is gone, t cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA make love on the simple hotel room bed We listen to the SOUNDS OF LOVE-MAKING as we move over th leave the bed, and move past a small table toward the win We travel through the window and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO is sitting on the ledge outside their room. His face is twisted in anger. Grief. He listens. He loves her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO climbs onto the roof of the building and perche the edge, like a deformed little gargoyle. TEARS stream d his cheeks. He clenches his fists. Muffles his own SCREAM Magnifico crouches there over-looking the city. His hand finds something. It is the VISI-SONAR. He stares at it fo amoment. Lifts his hands. Slowly Magnifico begins to play The notes are simple and so sad. The MUSIC carries on the wind drifting out into the night  68.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRAIL OF THE MUSIC
dialogues.text: We move away from the rooftop and wander through the city seeing regular everyday PEOPLE doing regular everyday thi They are cooking and sleeping and arguing and laughing, nothing any more or any less extraordinary than that. We in through windows, move down corridors, enter living roo We see the citizens of Terminus, not lingering long enoug know their histories, just enough to see a story of human A father tickles a little girl. A grandmother kisses an o photo. A woman fixes her face. A lonely man removes a coa We pass Pritcher and Bayta again, still making love, but donвЂ™t linger here either. They are just a small part of larger tapestry. We are travelling again past unknown fac And always MagnificoвЂ™s sad simple aching MUSIC plays on some eternal lament joining each of these strangers toget The music overwhelms them. First one. Then another and another. People are gradually but steadily invaded by gri It doesnвЂ™t matter what theyвЂ™re doing. Watching the ne Eating dinner. Undressing. Sitting together. Standing alone. Everybody in the area stops to feel MagnificoвЂ™s A man on the street canвЂ™t walk any further without weep The woman in front of her mirror watches the tears roll d her face. No one moves. No one speaks. A city in mourning Pritcher and Bayta look surprised to see each other cryin They try to understand it. We can see them trying to make sense of it, but they canвЂ™t and They hold one another. It looks like they will never let The music continues playing and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO removes his finger from the knob. The music STO He stares out over the city with a face drained of everyt but his deep and sickening hate. cUT TO:  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS rides a personal transport up through the leve of the Seldon equation. He reaches his destination and ge out, looking around a while to see if anyone has noticed Ebling pulls a piece of EQUIPMENT from the transport and moves quickly down a long mathematical corridor. Like a g about to commit a crime. He reaches his destination. Stop Ebling opens the device and pulls out two wires. He inser the ends into the equation, as if plugging two power cord into an invisible wall, and a spot OPENS inside the seque

dialogues.speaker: WARNING VOICE
dialogues.text: Your interpolation has not been authorized. Did you forget to submit your request, Professor? Ebling does not answer. Just works faster. His hands shak He takes his STYLUS and quickly draws that strange symbol the one we saw earlier -- into the equation. Immediately ALARM bellows, and all around him, the equation goes BERS A NEW CALCULATION RUNS and Ebling races through a storm o black numbers trying to follow the trail of a new red sequence as it solves itself. Now his eyes fill with horr

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: The planet Kalagan. Kalagan has fallen to the Mule! The TECHNICIANS all turn to watch as the equation ripples with the effects of EblingвЂ™s alteration. The large secu doors open and GUARDS rush in. Ebling raises his hands to trace the new future, trying t read as much as possible before they come. His voice crac

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anacron is next. Planet Anacron will fall today! Suddenly he is grabbed from behind by the guards, but Ebl doesnвЂ™t go without a struggle and they have to hold him him away. He keeps fighting. Ebling sees something as he is dragged off. Something tha makes him stop struggling.... He tries to understand it and (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guards deactivate his equipment. The equation abruptl RETURNS TO NORMAL -- and the secrets of the future disapp

dialogues.speaker: NOO0000000
dialogues.text: INT. THE MAYORвЂ™S OFFICE -- NIGHT MAYOR INDBAR waits in front of a big screen along with a of his STAFF. ItвЂ™s the middle of the night. TheyвЂ™re h dressed. Then a close-up of the GOVERNOR OF ANACRON appea There is a slight time delay between the two distant plan

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™s it going, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: CouldnвЂ™t be better. HowвЂ™s that speech coming?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™ll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Thanks. Hey, everything quiet over there on Anacron?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Quiet?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: No trouble of any kind?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Just another uneventful orbit around the sun, praise Seldon. Mayor Indbar is relieved. But also feels stupid for calli

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Yes, praise Seldon. (short pause) Well, this call is costing me a fortune. Good to see you, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Right back at you. The screen BLIPS OFF. Mayor Indbar turns to his staff wit (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s it. Keep that crazy old bastard away from the equation. And I do not want to hear the word mule again, you understand? cUT TO: INT. GOVERNORвЂ™S OFFICE -- DAY We see the GOVERNOR OF ANACRON in close-up, exactly as he appeared to Mayor Indbar, with the same friendly smile. T expression drains from his face. Not just that. His mouth falls open, and his bottom eyeli droop oddly. SomethingвЂ™s wrong. We pull back and see that he is a DECAPITATED HEAD being in the air by THE MULE. We pull back further and see thro a big window. The planet is BURNING. Buildings are FALLIN The Mule is gripping the head by its hair. He lifts up al thatвЂ™s left of the governor so that they are both eye-t Now the head speaks:

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: How did I do, sir?

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Thank you. The face of the governor spasms a little. Like heвЂ™s in

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: I think I might be hurt.

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: I removed your head. The face of the governor thinks about it rather casually

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s right. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Would you like to die now? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Very much. The Mule releases his grip on the governorвЂ™s hair and t head falls with a gross KUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE stands on the bridge, and stares out over his FL By now it is composed of vessels from three worlds. We ha never seen a fleet of ships even close to this size. He c surround a planet, literally. That ghostly suggestion of a face considers his great arm

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Set course for Foundation. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and EBLING MIS returns home. The GUARDS wh escorted him donвЂ™t leave the elevator. The doors slide and Ebling is all alone again. Or is he? He looks. A window is open. Someone is waiting in the dark. He can sense it. Moonlight is coming in through the window. Ebling sees th VISI-SONAR lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Magnifico? Is that you? There is no answer. He turns around and MAGNIFICO jumps o of the shadows like an animal. He knocks Ebling to the floor. Magnifico looks enraged. He wants to choke him to death. Ebling is in pain. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I played that thing! I played that thing like you told me to! Ebling speaks the best he can:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re hurting me-- Magnifico squeezes him, tight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I played and they felt it!

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I told you gifted players--

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Why did you do that to me?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: To show you.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: To show me what?!

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: You came here filled with fear and hate, but there is more in you than that. So much more-- Magnifico loosens his grip, and his face softens. He look like a scared little boy again.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: You made me like him.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I made them sad--

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: You shared your feelings. You gave them a gift.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: A gift?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not alone. No one is alone. We just think we are.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want to play anymore. Magnifico buries his face in EblingвЂ™s chest, and just h on. They stay there like that, on the floor where they fe After a moment Ebling pats him: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s all right, my boy. You donвЂ™t have to do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA walks to the window. Looks out. PRITCHER steps up behind her and slips his arms around her waist. The light the room is very strange. Something big is going on outsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city DOME is bursting with vivid colors and shapes, l a high-tech fireworks display filling the entire sky. PEO are looking out their windows, standing on the roofs, and venturing out into the streets. The citizens embrace one another, and gesture up at the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA watch them:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: This is it. The last day of the 1,000 Year Plan. Will they still feel like celebrating tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve watched things happen. Bad things. To a lot of people who deserved better. CouldвЂ™ve helped but never did. If the equation said that was the way things had to go down, that was good enough. Pritcher has been a man of few words. But these come easi

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There wasnвЂ™t a single morning I didnвЂ™t wake up knowing exactly where the day was taking me. I should be terrified right now, but IвЂ™m not. This is the first time the galaxy seems like ours. Bayta turns. He looks happy.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ll save it, or we wonвЂ™t, but it will finally be up to us. I (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: was taught that one man doesnвЂ™t make a difference. And not two. Not a hundred or a thousand.... You showed me different. She gently caresses his face.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I think Hari Seldon was a lonely man. I donвЂ™t think he ever felt this. If he had, he never would have written that equation. It never would have occurred to him. He would have known-- They turn back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some things canвЂ™t be counted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA wind their way through streets FILLED PEOPLE. ItвЂ™s like a New YearвЂ™s Eve celebration in Tim Square -- but spilling out onto every avenue in the city. Everyone is drinking and dancing and laughing. The human race has been waiting one thousand years to throw this pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA open a basement door and step inside a crowded little space. The NERDY MAN who escaped with Bayt looks up from behind a wall of terminals and makeshift equipment. SEVERAL MORE MEMBERS of the underground look over. Bayta holds up that tiny computer DISK for all to s

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a hell of a party. And wait until you meet the guest of honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR stands behind the podium looking a little wa out, but delivering his speech with the professionalism o experienced politician. The entire COUNCIL is in attendan The multiple CAMERAS transmit the speech out to the popul

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: In those ancient days ten centuries ago, when the First Galactic Empire was decaying into a paralysis that (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: would precede its final death, one lone voice spoke out for the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FACE OF MAYOR INDBAR is on billboards, on every scree big and small, on portable handheld viewers, and on the d The entire POPULATION watches:

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: Through the mathematics of psycho- history, he foresaw the course of the changing currents sweeping through the galaxy, and sacrificed his own life so that we might hear the word and listen. (short pause) That man was Hari Seldon. Everyone on the street CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR waits for the furious CLAPPING to stop and t

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: It was too late to prevent the Great Fall, but still possible to cut short the suffering and chaos to come, so that only a thousand years would separate the Second Empire from the First.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA watch the members of the UNDERGROUND a they furiously work at their makeshift consoles. And fina there is a loud BEEP. The whole apparatus comes to life a

dialogues.speaker: NERDY MAN
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s it. WeвЂ™re in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR keeps on talking:

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR
dialogues.text: We stand here now at the end of that single millennium, each of (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR INDBAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: us bearing witness to the culmination of SeldonвЂ™s dreams. At the other end of the council chamber, the old ornate V suddenly HUMS to life. No one notices at first. But then council member sitting in the back turns, annoyed at the He realizes that the noise is coming from the vault. Star MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) The hand of our great Foundation reaches across the stars and embraces every known world. The galaxy is civilized and peaceful. Another council member looks. Then another. Soon the enti chamber is turning around. Like a mysterious ancient secr the heavy LOCKING MECHANISM on the vault slowly rotates O Mayor Indbar begins to notice that everybody is looking a MAYOR INDBAR (CONTвЂ™D) (distracted) The internal health...of the Foundation is better than ev-- Finally he just stops and stares. The cameras swivel arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POPULATION of the city watches as the picture reels clumsily, and now the SELDON VAULT comes into focus. Ther are EXCLAMATIONS. People point. They see the vault OPEN a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the deep black of the vault is HARI SELDON. It mesmerizing. The face stares out from the darkness like a communication from the dead. MAYOR INDBARвЂ™S mouth hangs open. There are GASPS and th COUNCIL members stand upright. No one moves. No one speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA watches the tiny screen. Like she canвЂ™t believe i really worked. Like the moment is finally here. PRITCHER offers the MICROPHONE to her:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: You can do it. Save the world.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POPULATION of Terminus waits for Hari Seldon to speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA takes the mike and brings it to her lips. She opens her mouth to begin and hears:

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: This is Hari Seldon. Bayta stands there holding the mike. She didnвЂ™t say any yet. Everyone reacts with complete and utter astonishment

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: That wasnвЂ™t me. I didnвЂ™t say-- Pritcher and Bayta share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI SELDON suddenly rises from his chair and STEPS OUT O THE VAULT into the council chamber. Like itвЂ™s really hi Like he was waiting in there for 1,000 years. MAYOR INDBA and the COUNCIL react in awe and fear. No one dares breat

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: If any of you are standing feel free to sit down, and if you care to smoke, I wouldnвЂ™t mind. Why should I? IвЂ™m just a recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS steps out onto his terrace and looks up at the image of Seldon on the dome, like a true believer staring the heavens. MAGNIFICO follows.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: In a few hours they will come. I have no doubt the authorities will execute me. In fact I intend to see that they do. By the time you get this message, I will have been dead for a thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA move close and just hold onto one anot (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s been several centuries since I last addressed the Foundation. No doubt many of you believed the stories of my return were just wild superstition. Well good for you. I admire freethinkers. You were, however, wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO runs away and cowers in the corner. Afraid to s

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: I am as IвЂ™ve always been to those around me -- an annoying reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI SELDON stands in the council chamber, like any real politician delivering a speech before the assembled congr

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: Now to the matter at hand. You are here because my equation has led you through the ages to this point in space and time. You have no doubt wondered why I did not place true psycho-historians among the Foundation. The answer is quite simple. If I had, they would have discovered the truth. The recording pauses for effect. HARI SELDON (CONTвЂ™D) The equation is a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING stumbles back a few steps, as if from a physical b

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: The equation does not predict the future. It simply took you down the path I required you to travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POPULATION stares at the dome like they donвЂ™t under (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: It is not an instrument of profound or divine illumination -- but a method of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA look worried.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: вЂњPsycho-historyвЂќ rests on a single assumption so basic to its design that it is easily overlooked. To manipulate the future of the human race, it assumes there will be no fundamental change in human beings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI SELDON walks a little and the COUNCIL moves to make

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: My initial attempts to devise a plan to save civilization ended in frustration. Soon I realized my efforts were being thwarted, not by random events -- but by a genetic mutation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING shows the first signs of hope, and calls to MAGNIF

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: He saw the Mule! dHeвЂ™s going to tell us what to do! Magnifico peeks from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire COUNCIL watches as HARI SELDON stops and expla

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: How could I ever hope to combat such a creature from a distance of a thousand years, across the boundary between life and death? I decided to create--not one-- but two Foundations. The first would be highly visible, out in (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: the open...while the other would remain hidden and unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA begins to guess the truth. Her face fills with horr

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Oh god. WeвЂ™re bait. The decoy.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: This planet is the technological, economic, and political center of the galaxy. Your role in the plan is to be the final victims of the creature heading your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POPULATION stares at the dome. They are beginning to the idea that this is not good.

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: If I appear cruel or unmoved by the fate I have assigned to you, understand that I am attempting to achieve an optimum future for the entire human race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER takes BAYTA by the hand, and they run from the r

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: My decision to sacrifice you was a relatively easy one, and made long before any of you were born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING falls to the ground and presses his hands to his h

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: You may take some comfort in the knowledge that the real Foundation will survive -- at starвЂ™s end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI SELDON walks back to the vault. He turns a final tim (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARI SELDON
dialogues.text: One last thing. You know that psycho-history relies on the inherent predictability of whole societies, and not individuals. Each of you should feel free to try and survive the attack, if you so desire. MAYOR INDBAR and the COUNCIL look numb, and just stand th HARI SELDON (CONTвЂ™D) Either way it wonвЂ™t effect the outcome of the plan. Seldon walks inside the vault...and the old doors swing S Mayor Indbar stares at the vault like he expects Seldon t come back out and say just kidding, but the doors never o He releases a guttural YELL and runs at the vault. On cue the entire council does the same. A mob just waiting to explode. They reach the vault -- and force it onto its si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE on the roof stare up at the dome. One MAN turns an moves from the group. He walks toward the edge of the roo his face hopeless, and JUMPS. On a building across the street we see a WOMAN perched on edge. She jumps. ANOTHER MAN crawls out a window and jump People down on the street SCREAM as the bodies start to f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COUNCIL is striking the vault like madmen. Of course has no effect. MAYOR INDBAR pushes his way through the gr holding a METAL POLE. He tries to pry open the ancient lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIGHTS break out all through the city. People are SCREAMI and running. A POLICEMAN watches it without much expressi After a moment, he raises his own GUN. Sticks the barrel his mouth. The people continue to fight as we hear the SH  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR INDBAR and the members of the COUNCIL manage to pry doors. They force open the vault, their faces triumphant, and look down. It is empty. They begin to fight each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is pandemonium. People are smashing the WINDOW Men are STRANGLING EACH OTHER and women are being sexuall ASSAULTED. Two more policemen raise their guns, point the at one another, and FIRE. A wounded man is LIFTED in the and thrown. A fleeing old woman falls down and is quickly TRAMPLED. A group of men OVERTURN a car and FIRES break o A REPORTER stands there with a microphone, insanely LAUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power plant WORKERS step up to their stations and lift he tools, or whatever they can find. THEY DESTROY THE CONSOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA try to make it through the MOB. People are tearing each other apart all around them. A VICIOUS M blocks their path. He looks rabid. Pritcher takes him dow

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Did you see his face?! This is not just panic-- Pritcher yells over the din:

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: The Mule is here! All through the city, the POWER GOES OUT. Up above them t colors and images running on the dome abruptly disappear we can see through to space. The planet is SURROUNDED BY A FLEET OF WARSHIPS in low or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS are engaging in hand-to-hand combat with their fellow soldiers. Some manage to pull guns and FIRE. A YOU OFFICER notices the high-tech planetary display, and sees starships in orbit. He looks around for someone. Calls ou (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir weвЂ™re under attack! Sir-- He looks underneath a desk and sees the GENERAL hiding th He has the shakes. He canвЂ™t stop himself from trembling

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Run away run away run away....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS watches the city destroy itself. He looks empt and lost. Slowly he turns to go. MAGNIFICO follows, scare

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Wait-- W-where are you going? Ebling walks toward the elevator like a condemned man hea for the firing squad. Magnifico doesnвЂ™t know what to do and looks over at the VISI-SONAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER and BAYTA move through a narrow alley littered w CORPSES. Like they all killed each other. Now they see hi EBLING emerges from the building. He looks at the bodies the burning wreckage. There is the sound of FOOTSTEPS, an Ebling sees the MuleвЂ™s SOLDIERS marching through the st Slowly Ebling starts toward the grim soldiers, as if he w to die. He spreads out his arms, pleading, asking for dea Pritcher and Bayta run toward him. Try to get there in ti

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Ebling! The soldiers stop. Raise their RIFLES, in unison. Take ai Suddenly a SHATTERING SOUND pierces the air. Pritcher put his hands over his ears and falls. Everything goes BLACK. He opens his eyes a moment later. Sees Bayta coming aroun beside him. The soldiers are lying motionless on the stre They rush to Ebling, beginning to stir. They help him up Pritcher sees MAGNIFICO standing there. With the VISI-SON

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: I played for them. Bad music. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The warships in orbit FIRE ON THE DOME and the entire CIT RUMBLES and shakes. Like an earthquake. But the dome hold Pritcher sees a HATCH IN THE STREET and runs over. Opens

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. No more under the ground!

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t want to be here when that dome breaks. The warships FIRE ON THE DOME again and the city RUMBLES. enormous CRACK snakes across the dome, like a rip in the -..and Magnifico quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER, BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING descend a ladder d into a high-tech subterranean tunnel system. They make it the bottom, looking beat, and find a long horizontal pass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warships FIRE on the dome, and the sky fills with CRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a deafening ALARM sounds. A series of thick EMERGENCY DOORS emerge from the walls threatening to seal off the tunnel. PRITCHER, BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING start to r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warships FIRE once again. The REMAINING POPULATION of the city stops their fighting and smashing. They look up the dome...and what they see shakes them out of their fre For one last moment they are just everyday frightened peo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER, BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING rush through the l door and fall to the floor. The tunnel seals with a DOOOO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warships FIRE one final time and the great dome SHATT (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The enormous shards do not fall but are BLOWN OUT into sp PEOPLE SCREAM AS THEY RISE INTO THE AIR. The dead and liv alike are hurled into orbit. Everything not tied down goe up. VEHICLES and GARBAGE. Men and women try to run but ar lifted off their feet as if by the hand of some vengeful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE watches. Reflected in his forcefield, we see PEO AND OBJECTS HURL INTO SPACE. An image of apocalyptic horr There is nothing left on the planet but the remains of th shattered dome, and empty streets. In a matter of seconds Terminus City has been horrifically and vilely evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MULE walks the empty streets. A group of SOLDIERS fol along, a breathing apparatus added to their uniforms. The Mule stops now. His ghostly undefined face surveys the scene. It is a metal ghost town. The Mule steps over to a HATCH in the street. He studies

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: There are survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER, BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING move quickly throu completely automated facility. CORPSES are sprawled on th floor, and SCREAMS echo through the passages with regular Every so often a PANICKED SURVIVOR can be glimpsed runnin through the adjoining corridors. The entire place is cree They open a door and see a LOADING ZONE. A series of SMAL PODS are being automatically filled with materials, and t the pods are carried on a CONVEYOR BELT out through a tun

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: The cannon transports materials to the moon. We should drift right through the blockade. If the Mule hasnвЂ™t destroyed the refinery it will catch us, open our pods, and we can commandeer a small shuttle. Pritcher gets right to work. Everyone else just stares at him. Finally he turns back with: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) DonвЂ™t worry. They used to put animals in these things.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Did they ever survive the trip?

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Usually, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airlock opens and THE MULE enters. His SOLDIERS quickl spread out through the underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING sits inside of a small pod, like a cramped metal e and just stares straight ahead. Not caring if he lives or dies. BAYTA checks the straps:

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: How does that feel? Ebling turns to her. After a moment, he seems to recogniz her. His eyes fill with TEARS. He tries to speak but canв Bayta wants to cry too. Instead she kisses his forehead, seals up the pod. She watches the conveyor take Ebling aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS hurry through the tunnels finding SURVIVORS. A f put up a fight. The soldiers march them through the compl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER checks the straps around BAYTA. She wants him to look at her, really look at her, but he is avoiding her e

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Please -- look at me. He stops. Looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to tell you-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: (stopping her) Why donвЂ™t you tell me next time I see you. Bayta looks stronger now. As if thatвЂ™s given her confid

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l tell you. On the moon. ...and they kiss one last time. MAGNIFICO sits off in the corner, and just watches them k Pritcher pulls away and seals the pod. It moves off into dark, and disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small POD moves through a series of passages. It is a bumpy ride for anyone inside and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod is knocked around, even rolled over. BAYTA canвЂ™ a thing. No windows. Her BREATHING quickens. The pod fall a small distance and jerks to a stop. Bayta is reclining back like an astronaut waiting for the countdown to begin There is an enormous ROAR. She is pushed back into her se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small POD is propelled through an enormously long BAR At the end of it lies the STARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POD bursts from the opening atop the highest MOUNTAIN sails into orbit. It floats harmlessly past the fleet of WARSHIPS and follows the other pods tumbling toward the M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER opens the next pod. He looks at MAGNIFICO and sa

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Come on. DonвЂ™t be afraid. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Magnifico just stays in the corner and stares. His voice a little different. A bit edgy.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: PRITCHER
dialogues.text: Glad to know it, now move. He enters a few numbers on the small console in the inter PRITCHER (CONTвЂ™D) YouвЂ™re going to hear a lot of noises and be bumped around a little. Then youвЂ™ll have the acceleration. After that you wonвЂ™t feel a thing-- Pritcher turns around again, and Magnifico hits him with LARGE PIPE. Pritcher goes down. He falls hard. His head is bleeding. He tries to get up a Magnifico looks frantic. Hits him again. This time he sta down. Magnifico edges close, slowly, like heвЂ™s still af But he grows more confident and:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: You have to stay. You canвЂ™t come. You have to stay here. Suddenly he kicks him and yells. MAGNIFICO (CONTвЂ™D) Stupid. Stupid! Now he looks as if he might cry:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was supposed to love me, not you. Not you. Magnifico inches toward the pod.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She will love me. She will! Magnifico climbs into the pod. He straps himself in. The small capsule seals shut and disappears inside of the tun Pritcher tries to force himself up. Falls back to the flo  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod is fired from the cannon. MAGNIFICO looks terrifi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS move down the tunnels, and stop at the entra to the loading area. They take a moment to get ready then run inside. But no one is here. The soldiers take position and FIRE. The pods burst and t entire complex GRINDS TO A HALT. Now we see PRITCHER painfully pulling himself into a rece He tries not to make a sound....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PODS tumble toward the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA sits inside the small capsule. Her hair drifts in t zero-gravity. She just BREATHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO acts like a crazy man trapped inside a padded r He beats on the hull and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING stares straight ahead. Thinks. After a moment he reaches in his pocket for a PEN. He writes on the interior of the pod, numbers and symbols calculating faster. And faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PODS tumble toward the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SURVIVORS are lined up along either side of a tunnel. The look strange. Emotionless. THE MULE strolls down the aisl (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Terminus has fallen. Now I will remake the galaxy in my image. I will begin here, with you, the last survivors of the Foundation. Inside of the fields, that ghostly suggestion of a man gr

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tear off your faces. The survivors bring their hands to their faces and dig th fingers into the skin. We follow the Mule as he moves awa and soon begin to hear SCREAMS. The Mule walks further. Abruptly, he stops. As if he has sensed something. He seems to forget it and simply walks Down a dark passage, and around the corner, we find PRITC He stands flat against the wall trying not to be seen. Th agonized screams of the survivors ripping their faces ECH through the tunnels. He waits. After a moment he sees the coast is clear. The BODY of a soldier is at his feet. And Pritcher is wearing his unifo SOLDIERS are marching down the tunnels, leaving the facil Pritcher puts on the helmet and The screams are OVER. Pritcher enters the tunnel. He step past the bodies lying on the floor, their faces a bloody mess, and joins the soldiers.... cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA sails inside the claustrophobic capsule. Suddenly s hears a sound. A THUMPING on the hull. She CRIES OUT in surprise as the pod violently rocks. More DEAFENING NOISE and finally the top swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA has arrived at the automated facility and her pod i moving along a conveyor toward the large GRAPPLING ARMS t are unloading the raw materials. Bayta jumps out of the p She looks around. Sees something. EBLINGвЂ™S POD is lying open, the interior visible. She steps closer to it. Close (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The inside of the pod is FILLED with mathematics. Ebling scribbled an equation on every available inch of space. I looks like the work of a madman. Bayta starts walking through the facility looking for Ebl ItвЂ™s not hard. She just follows the calculation SCRAWLE THE WALLS. Bayta grows worried. She sees him through a small hatch. EBLING is hurrying ba and-forth across the cabin of a SHUTTLE. His movements ar energetic. This isnвЂ™t the man who wanted to die on Term

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA steps inside and watches EBLING. He does not even s to notice her there, and when he does turn around, acts l thereвЂ™s no time for salutations.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Oh, youвЂ™re just in time to help me program the jump coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Are you feeling all right?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: What? Never better! Could you step out of the way? ThereвЂ™s no time to lose. Bayta moves out of the way and Ebling fiddles with a cons

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Where are we going? Ebling grabs her, his eyes afire:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: To find the Second Foundation! And he runs around the cabin again. Bayta looks dumbfound

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: How do we know there even is a Second Foundation?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Because Hari Seldon told us so. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: In a message 1,000 years old. Even if he did create another one thereвЂ™s no guarantee they survived.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: They survived. IвЂ™m sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Then where the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Seldon told us. We will find them вЂњat starвЂ™s end.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (way too cheerful) I havenвЂ™t the slightest idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another POD arrives. MAGNIFICO frantically scrambles out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA tries to talk some sense into the seemingly mad EBL

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: If theyвЂ™re out there, then why didnвЂ™t they do something by now? Why didnвЂ™t they help us?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Suppose we had known about the existence of another Foundation somewhere in the galaxy. What would we have done?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Gone looking for them.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: And that is why their existence was kept secret. But donвЂ™t you think the other Foundation would have suffered the same curiosity? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re saying Seldon didnвЂ™t tell them the truth either?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: What better method to keep them hidden? To keep them safe! Ebling keeps running about:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They may not even know about the Mule or suspect their true purpose in the Plan. They may be waiting for us to find them.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (skeptically) At starвЂ™s end.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Precisely!

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: That sonuvabitch Hari Seldon put us here to die. You heard him as well as I did.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: He couldnвЂ™t speak freely. The Mule might have been listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGNIFICO follows the equations scrawled on the walls. No he hears the MUTED talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING moves to BAYTA. He speaks with heartfelt convictio

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: My mind has never been clearer. I canвЂ™t explain it. ItвЂ™s like Seldon is operating through me. I know we were put here for a reason -- and it wasnвЂ™t to die. It canвЂ™t have been only to die! She looks like she wants to believe. It is just not in he (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You think I hate everything you stand for, but youвЂ™re wrong. I wish I could believe the universe is following some master вЂњplan,вЂќ and everything is happening the way it should, but I just canвЂ™t. MAGNIFICO is at the hatch. They see him...and the express on his face. Immediately Bayta knows somethingвЂ™s very w

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Soldiers. The soldiers came. He fought them, bravely, but there were too many. He was hurt, very badly. Bayta takes a step back, as if that will somehow make him stop, and finally her legs give out. She falls to the flo Magnifico runs to her. Takes her hand. Looks into her eye

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With his last bit of strength he put me in the pod and told me to go. He said that I had to take care of you. For him. Bayta is trying not to break down. It is taking everythin that she has just to listen:

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then he died. Magnifico suddenly reaches out and wraps his arms around holding her, comforting her. And when his ugly little face is out of view he slowly gr cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS walk through the corridors in perfect format

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS are methodically removing their armor. One o them takes off his helmet revealing PRITCHER. The men and women around him move by rote. Devoid of emotion. They do not look at each other. Do not talk. Pritcher watches the  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS file out of the room and disperse through th corridors, human automatons going about their assigned ta PRITCHER drains the emotion from his face. Walks through passage doing his best to mimic the others taken by the M cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but stars. Now a SHUTTLE jumps back into real spa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING MIS and MAGNIFICO stare out at the ruins of TRANTO It looks like a great metal ball, but the surface is scar and rusted. A giant scrap-heap.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Trantor. This was the heart of the First Galactic Empire. If there are clues to the meaning of the phrase starвЂ™s end, they may be found in the old library. But there are no continents or seas to help us with navigation. Ebling sinks into his chair. Suddenly, he looks frustrate Uncertain. Like it is too much.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isnвЂ™t my area of expertise-- Magnifico lays his hand on EblingвЂ™s shoulder to reassur

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re the smartest man I ever met, Professor. YouвЂ™1ll figure it out. Ebling doesnвЂ™t have confidence, and is about to say so, his expression suddenly changes:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (getting an idea) The palace could be seen from space. If we can find the remains of the Imperial Palace we may be able to extrapolate the location of the library... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts tapping furiously at the controls. Magnifico le him work, not wanting to disturb him, and quietly moves a Now he sees BAYTA at the hatch. She must have been watchi

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: Are you feeling better, Bayta? Bayta nods her head. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m glad. And he leaves the main cabin. Bayta watches him go, as if some worry or suspicion has begun to enter her mind. She moves across the cabin, looks around, and pulls open a pa Inside are a number of BLASTERS. She takes out one of the holsters. Looks at it for a mome and almost puts it back. Then quickly she buckles it arou her waist. Something BEEPS and

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: The Imperial Palace, I found-- Ebling sees what she is wearing. Bayta pulls the weapon f its holster. She looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing with that gun?

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: Holding it.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I can see that. Why? Bayta holsters the blaster. She stares after Magnifico wi

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING make their way through the deteriorating husk of Trantor. The entire planet was enca in metal and the surface is one long endless interior. Th only current inhabitants seem to be exceedingly large VER The place has an unsettling life of its own. Although dar and cavernous, scattered technology still runs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They hear the occasional deep RUMBLE of machinery coming life. Now and then they see blinking lights or jerking automatic doors. Bayta wields a FLASHLIGHT and leads the group. She has a PACK on her back filled with supplies, and wears her BLAS Ebling is beginning to show signs of fatigue. ItвЂ™s not to traverse this wreckage. Magnifico moves close, and Ebl puts an arm around his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Over there! Shine your light-- Bayta points the flashlight. A door is partly open, and beyond, we see what could be the remains of the old archi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA, MAGNIFICO, and EBLING squeeze in through the doors look around at the vast space that once held the accumula knowledge of the empire. The ghosts of the past are palpa here, such obvious accomplishment laid waste. No one spea Ebling and Magnifico walk together to a high-tech PEDESTA and Ebling gently lays his hand on it. Waits. After a lon moment one small LIGHT within shines dimly. A spark of li

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (to Magnifico) There is hope. Come. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You need to rest now.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m fine.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: You look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ll feel better when I get to work. DonвЂ™t worry. Magnifico will attend me. Bayta just watches the two of them lumber off into the ru cUT TO:  99. INT. MULEвЂ™S QUARTERS -- DAY THE MULE moves through his living quarters encased in his forcefields, every movement accompanied by that familiar

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: There was a time when I was nothing -- and the universe was determined that I remain so. The room is packed with FOLLOWERS. Men and women of varyi ages. They are positioned casually around the room, as if theyвЂ™re all guests at a dinner party listening to their The blank expressions on their faces make it one eerie pa THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) Then one day, men came...brutal men, with the desire to kill me. My death had nothing to offer them, save for simple amusement. As the Mule wanders through the room his soldiers all mov their heads, following him, their faces devoid of express THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) As the killing blows descended upon me I began to welcome the darkness and the peace sure to come. Then, to my surprise, I felt my essence expanding -- until I was observing my body being beaten, watching through the very eyes of my assailants. There is a collective GASP from everyone present. They ar like living marionettes playing their parts in his sick s THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) My mind was repulsed by what I saw and I instinctively let out a single thought: STOP! And stop they did. At the moment that should have been my death, the power within me came to life, and my would-be killers became the first of my вЂњdevotedвЂќ followers. Now a big creepy smile appears on every face inside the r THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) With them I took a town. With the town I took a city. With the city I took a world. Then (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: another and another -- and now the Foundation itself. And there is unanimous CLAPPING. THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) The so-called guardians of the human race, who did not care enough about one human being, have paid the price for their hypocrisy. In the rear of the room, behind the others, we find PRITC THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) The Foundation was blinded by the false teachings of Seldon. He taught them that history will make puppets of us all... but am I not living proof to the contrary? The ghostly suggestion of a face stares out at his follow THE MULE (CONTвЂ™D) I have done in days what Seldon could not do in a thousand years! The galaxy is in order at last. The Second Empire has arrived... and I am its Emperor.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWERS
dialogues.text: (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: ALL HAIL MULE
dialogues.text: Pritcher watches from the rear, not quick enough to join but none of them seem to notice. The Mule turns and looks at the stars. For the first time he sounds a little melancholy, even through the distortio caused by his thick forcefields.

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE
dialogues.text: Will the future call me master, or monster? Perhaps I am just the man who upset the universe. Pause. Now he sounds impatient:

dialogues.speaker: THE MULE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me. I must rest. Everyone turns in unison and heads out of the room. Pritc steals one last look at the Mule.  101. INT. SHIPвЂ™S BARRACKS -- NIGHT The MuleвЂ™s SOLDIERS lie flat on their backs, arms at th sides, legs together, everyone sleeping like theyвЂ™re sp on a cold slab in some morgue. Lying among them is PRITCH After a moment he opens his eyes. Very slowly, Pritcher rises. He sets his feet on the floo gently. Now stands up. Pritcher walks past the other bunk He reaches the door and it opens. INT. SHIPвЂ™S CORRIDOR -- NIGHT PRITCHER edges out into the passage. No one here. It look like a ghost ship. He moves stealthily through the corrid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER works inside a narrow claustrophobic space. He i constructing a small SPHERE that resembles a strange gren INT. SHIPвЂ™S CORRIDOR -- NIGHT Standing right outside the door where Pritcher is working see a dozen of the MuleвЂ™s SOLDIERS. They stand there li live zombies, without expression, watching the door creep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER finishes his work. Returns the tools. He hides t small SPHERE in his clothes. Takes a moment to remove the emotion from his face, and gets ready. He opens the door INT. SHIPвЂ™S CORRIDOR -- NIGHT The corridor is empty again. Like a ghost ship. PRITCHER looks around...and starts carefully back down the passage cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA conceals herself behind the ancient data banks. She watches MAGNIFICO dart from between the aisles and quickl scurry off, his arms overflowing with dusty over-sized BO (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Only when Magnifico has gone does Bayta step into the ope She moves down the aisles looking for Ebling. Sees a tabl overflowing with more old volumes and active VIEWING DEVI There is a tangle of CORDS everywhere connecting the view and the dim LIGHTS to various small POWER SOURCES. No sig of Ebling yet. Then she hears what sounds like SCRATCHING ...and sees EBLING on the floor. Bayta does not look pleased. Ebling is scrawling an ENORM EQUATION on the floor of the archive. He crawls on his ha and knees. He does not look up, but knows that she is the

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: I tell you sometimes I wonder what is going on inside me. I seem to recall a time when so much was a mystery to me, and now I see it and I understand. He does not stop writing. He never stops. Not for a momen A series of makeshift FLOODLIGHTS illuminate the equation We can see that this thing stretches on into the darkest recesses of the ruins. HeвЂ™s going to cover the entire f

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are numerous references to starвЂ™s end from the time of Hari Seldon, but they do not indicate a specific region, interpreting the phrase as meaning the far or opposite end of the known galaxy. Bayta watches him. The way you look at a loved one who is starting to slip away into sickness or insanity. He goes

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course what is the other end of the galaxy? It is circular, and a circle has no end. Follow the rim of a circle and you end up back at your starting point! He does not stop writing. He never stops. Not for a momen

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But in truth the galaxy is not a flat ovoid, nor is the periphery a closed curve. It is a double spiral -- and what is the other end of a spiral, but the center? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everything that comes out of his mouth makes her want to He babbles on faster and faster:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And so you see that any attempt at a physical interpretation of the phrase not only fails to pin down the location, but actually expands the area of search to include all of colonized space! He does not stop writing. He never does. Not for a moment

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is an irrelevant solution, and we must remember that Hari Seldon was a psycho-historian, not a physical scientist. And what would вЂњstarвЂ™s endвЂќ mean to a man of his sensibilities? Bayta waits for the rest of it, knowing she wonвЂ™t like bit...but the rest never comes. Ebling is staring in shock at the equation he just comple

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my word. cur TO: INT. MULEвЂ™S QUARTERS -- NIGHT PRITCHER slips inside the dark quarters and patiently sur the scene. No one here. He moves quietly across the room a new vantage point. Looks clear. Quickly Pritcher moves deeper into the room, and stops be a door, his back against the wall. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA watches helplessly as EBLING scurries around lookin down at the equation at his feet. Like he cannot believe

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: What is it? What do you see? cUT TO:  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER looks inside. There is a large empty bed. THE MU can be seen staring out the window with his back to the d In one fluid motion Pritcher runs into the room and throw the strange SPHERE he made. The thing sails through the a It attaches to the MuleвЂ™s back and ELECTRICITY SNAKES C around his body ATTACKING HIS FORCEFIELDS. The Mule writh And suddenly, he stops his jerking. The Mule falls backwa He hits the floor hard flat on his back. The forcefields in FLUX. Pritcher runs to the Mule and stands over the bo Pritcher holds a JAGGED PIECE OF METAL like a homemade kn The first layer of forcefield SPUTTERS OUT. The Mule is m visible than ever before. There really is a man in there The forcefields continue to SPARK -- and now the second l SPUTTERS OUT. The face of the Mule comes into sharper foc Pritcher positions his grisly weapon and waits for the re of the field to give way. He canвЂ™t wait to thrust the k cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EBLING turns to BAYTA finally. He looks like a wild man, face gaunt and sick, his hair a tangle. Ebling stares out with eyes full of illumination:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: There is a Second Foundation, and it can win. Bayta. The Second Foundation can defeat the Mule if it is given time! Bayta listens to him. Despite her better judgement she fi herself getting caught up in the moment, hoping against h

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It must not be taken. If it is captured by the Mule prematurely then we are lost. Bayta sees MAGNIFICO slowly, quietly emerge from the shad (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: (roughly) You. Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Let him stay and hear it all.

dialogues.speaker: BAYTA
dialogues.text: No. I want him to go -- now. Magnifico looks from one to the other not knowing what to

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: (in anger and pain) Let me speak. I have to get this out of my head! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER is poised over the prone body of THE MULE. The l layer of forcefield DISAPPEARS-- And Pritcher looks down in surprise at the face staring b It is pale like a corpse. The eyes are rolled back in the sockets and the mouth hangs open. A bullet HOLE in its he Pritcher stares at the face of the PRESIDENT of planet Ha cur TO: FLASHBACK. On television the President holds a pistol to own head smiling happily, and pulls the trigger to a GUNS cUT TO: Pritcher stares at the face. Out of the open mouth comes vile sound slowly rising up from the throat. It is LAUGHT cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA watches MAGNIFICO. He wants to hear what EBLING fou

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: The Second Foundation has kept itself secret with good reason. The secrecy must be upheld, do you hear me? It has a purpose. cUT TO:  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRITCHER tries to run away--but only makes it a few feet- then he canвЂ™t control his legs. He drops onto his knees that LAUGHTER fills the room and Pritcher brings his hands to his head, his face contorted pain, and finally, he collapses. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAYTA looks like she wants to stop it all. She just liste

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: No matter what happens to us, the Mule must not discover the true meaning of вЂњstarвЂ™s end.вЂќ Bayta turns. Watches MAGNIFICO.

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to go. The information we carry is vital. We must get to the Second Foundation before the Mule does.

dialogues.speaker: MAGNIFICO
dialogues.text: You know where theyвЂ™re hiding?

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS
dialogues.text: Yes. Ebling looks at Magnifico, and smiles, as if the promise peace is here at last. He says:

dialogues.speaker: EBLING MIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Finally, I can tell you. The Second Foundation-- There is a DEAFENING NOISE. We are looking at a RAGGED HO in the wall where Ebling stood.
